summary.para: This class is used to specify the position of tables and paragraphs in a Word document. Although the term "absolute" is used, the position is relative to some location in the document or page. Absolute positioning is set in twips. 1 twip = 1/20 pt = 1/1440 in.

remarks.para: You cannot create an object using the new keyword. You must get it from a or object using the AbsolutePositioning property.
The following sample gets the AbsolutePositioning object of the first table of a document.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim firstTable As Table = doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Table)(0) Dim ap As AbsolutePositioning = firstTable.AbsolutePositioning

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the x coordinate in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

para.code:
'--- Get X Dim x As Integer = oAbsolutePositioning.X
'--- Set X to 1 inch oAbsolutePositioning.X = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the position's y coordinate in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

para.code:
'--- Get Y Dim y As Integer = oAbsolutePositioning.Y
'--- Set Y to 1 inch oAbsolutePositioning.Y = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the absolute width in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: The width of Paragraph must be between 0.01" (15 twips) and 22" (31680 twips). The width of a table must be between 0" (0 twips) and 22" (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.

para.code:
'--- Get Width Dim width As Integer = oAbsolutePositioning.Width
'--- Set Width to 3 inches oAbsolutePositioning.Width = 4320

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the height in twips.

remarks.para: The width of Paragraph must be between 0.01" (15 twips) and 22" (31680 twips). The width of a table must be between 0" (0 twips) and 22" (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.

para.code:
'--- Get Height Dim height As Integer = oAbsolutePositioning.Height
'--- Set Height to 3 inches oAbsolutePositioning.Height = 4320

summary.para: Specifies whether is an exact height (true) or a minimum height (false).

para.code:
'--- Get HeightExact Dim heightExact As Boolean = oAbsolutePositioning.HeightExact
'--- Set HeightExact oAbsolutePositioning.HeightExact = True

summary.para: Returns the horizontal origin of the position's . Possible values are: Column, Margin, Page.

para.code:
'--- Get HorizontalOrigin Dim oHorizontalOrigin As AbsolutePositioning.HorizontalOrigin = oAbsolutePositioning.OriginX
'--- Set HorizontalOrigin oAbsolutePositioning.OriginX= AbsolutePositioning.HorizontalOrigin.Margin

summary.para: Sets or returns the vertical origin of the position's . Possible values are: Margin, Page, Text.

para.code:
'--- Get VerticalOrigin Dim oVerticalOrigin As AbsolutePositioning.OriginY = oAbsolutePositioning.VerticalOrigin
'--- Set VerticalOrigin oAbsolutePositioning.OriginY = AbsolutePositioning.VerticalOrigin.Page

summary.para: An value specifies the vertical origin of a table or paragraph position's y coordinate.

Doc.summary: The position's x coordinate is relative to the left edge of the current column. If the page does not contain multiple columns, HorizontalOrigin.Column and HorizontalOrigin.Margin are equivalent.
The position's x coordinate is relative to the left margin of the page.
The position's x coordinate is relative to the left border of the page.
The position's x coordinate is relative to the position of the table or paragraph if it were not absolutely positioned.

summary.para: An value specifies the vertical origin of a table or paragraph position's y coordinate.

Doc.summary: The position's y coordinate is relative to the top margin of the page.
The position's y coordinate is relative to the top border of the page.
The position's y coordinate is relative to the position of the table or paragraph if it were not absolutely positioned.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.AdaptiveMemoryStream
member.summary: A stream which uses a MemoryStream for small amounts of data, and switches to a NonContiguousMemoryStream for larger amounts of data. This avoids the 4mb floor on allocations that NonContiguousMemoryStream has

summary.para: When you import data to a table in your document, you can use the interface to specify how the imported data should be formatted in the table. AutoFormatter contains a single method - - which must be implemented in a class that you will use as an AutoFormatter. When you import data, set to the class that you created.
This method must be implemented by the class you want to use as an AutoFormatter. Then, when you import data, you can use to set the AutoFormatter for that data import.

param.name: aCell
param.para: The table cell to format.

param.name: aRow
param.para: The 0-based row index of the cell to format.

param.name: aColumn
param.para: The 0-based column index of the cell to format.

param.name: aLocation
param.para: The location of the cell in relation to the outer edge of the table.

summary.para: An value specifies the location of a table cell in relation to the outer edge of the table.

Doc.summary: The cell is in the bottom row of the table.
The cell is in the bottom left corner of the table.
The cell is in the bottom right corner of the table.
The cell is in the left column of the table.
The cell is not within a row or column at the outer edge of the table.
The cell is in the right column of the table.
The cell is in the top row of the table.
The cell is in the top left corner of the table.
The cell is in the top right corner of the table.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.BlockingInputStream
member.summary:
Implementation of a BlockingInputStream to provide data to RawDataBlock that expects data in 512 byte chunks. Useful to read data from slow (ie, non FileInputStream) sources, for example when reading an OLE2 Document over a network.
Possible extentions: add a timeout. Curently a call to read(byte[]) on this class is blocking, so use at your own peril if your underlying stream blocks.
member.author: Jens Gerhard
aviks - documentation cleanups.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.BlockingInputStream.read(System.SByte[])
member.summary: We had to revert to byte per byte reading to keep with slow network connections on one hand, without missing the end-of-file. This is the only method that does its own thing in this class everything else is delegated to aggregated stream. THIS IS A BLOCKING BLOCK READ!!!

Note: This character position may be changed, in particular when markers are added to a repeat block this updated to be the index within the block, so if a subclass bases data off the original cp, this should be overloaded to update that data.
@param originalCP the updated "original" Character Position of this marker to set

summary.para: This class is used to represent a bookmark in the document. Bookmarks can be added to a document in Word or programmatically using WordWriter. They can only be retrieved form an existing document.

remarks.para: To insert a bookmark into a document, use or . To get a bookmark from an existing document use the method.
The following sample shows you how to add a bookmark to a document and retrieve a bookmark from a document.

para.code:
'--- Create a bookmark Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") doc.CreateBookmark("MyBookMark")
'--- Get an existing bookmark Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim bmark As Bookmark = doc.GetBookmark("ExistingBookmark")
'--- Or, if you know the order of the bookmarks in the document '--- you can use the following: 'Dim bmark as Bookmark = doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Bookmark)(0)

summary.para: This class is used to represent a region of the document that can be edited. This is the main class for manipulating the Word object model. Most elements of a inherit from the class.

remarks.para: You cannot create a new Element object by using the new keyword. There are various properties
The following sample demonstrates getting an Element object by retrieving a section's header:

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim sect As Section = doc.Sections(0) Dim e As Element = sect.GetHeader(Section.HeaderFooterType.All)

summary.para: Returns a collection of objects that represent all the elements in the document of the specified type.

param.name: type
param.para: An Element.Type representing the type of element to be returned.

returns.para: A a collection of Element objects that represent all the elements in the document of the specified type.

para.code: Element[] eArray = e.GetElements(Element.Type.Paragraph);
Dim eArray As Element() = e.GetElements(Element.Type.Paragraph)

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a sub Element within this Element based on the specified start and end offsets.

param.name: start
param.para: An int representing the starting offset of the sub Element relative to the start of this Element.

param.name: end
param.para: An int representing the ending offset of the sub Element relative the start of this Element.

returns.para: A Element object that represents a sub Element within this Element.

para.code: Element subE = e.SubElement();
Dim subE As Element = e.SubElement()

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the location specified by the offset. The Position object can be used similar to a cursor.

param.name: offset
param.para: An int representing the relative offset from the start of this Element to get the Position for.

returns.para: A Position object that represents the location specified by the offset.

para.code: Position oPosition = e.GetPosition();
Dim oPosition As Position = e.GetPosition()

summary.para: Inserts a break of the specified type before the element.

param.name: type
param.para: A that specifies the type of break to insert

summary.para: Inserts a break of the specified type after the element.

param.name: type
param.para: A that specifies the type of break to insert

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a new empty paragraph at the beginning of this Element. The paragraph that is inserted will have the style specified. If this Element is in the middle of a paragraph, the containing paragraph will be split.

param.name: style
param.para: A object representing the base style of this paragraph. The base style also affects the character style of any text added to this paragraph. If this is null, the style will be "Normal".

returns.para: A Paragraph object that represents a new empty paragraph at the beginning of this Element. Even though the paragraph is empty there will always be at least a single carriage return.

para.code: Paragraph p = e.InsertParagraphBefore(doc.Styles[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal]);
Dim p As Paragraph = e.InsertParagraphBefore(doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal))

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a new empty paragraph at the end of this Element. The paragraph that is inserted will have the style specified. If this Element is in the middle of a paragraph, the containing paragraph will be split.

param.name: style
param.para: A object representing the base style of this paragraph. The base style also affects the character style of any text added to this paragraph. If this is null, the style will be "Normal".

returns.para: A Paragraph object that represents a new empty paragraph at the beginning of this Element. Even though the paragraph is empty there will always be at least a single carriage return.

para.code: Paragraph p = e.InsertParagraphAfter(doc.Styles[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal]);
Dim p As Paragraph= e.InsertParagraphAfter(doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal))

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a new empty paragraph at the beginning of this Element. The paragraph that is inserted will have the style specified, to which any additional specified paragraph formatting is applied as well. If this Element is in the middle of a paragraph, the containing paragraph will be split.

param.name: style
param.para: A object representing the base style of this paragraph. The base style also affects the character style of any text added to this paragraph. If this is null, the style will be "Normal".

param.name: props
param.para: A that represents formatting properties that should override the paragraph properties found in the style.

returns.para: A Paragraph object that represents a new empty paragraph at the beginning of this Element. Even though the paragraph is empty there will always be at least a single carriage return.

para.code: Paragraph p = e.InsertParagraphBefore(doc.Styles[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal], pFormatting);
Dim p As Paragraph = e.InsertParagraphBefore(doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal), pFormatting)

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a new empty paragraph at the end of this Element. The paragraph that is inserted will have the style specified, to which any additional specified paragraph formatting is applied as well. If this Element is in the middle of a paragraph, the containing paragraph will be split.

param.name: style
param.para: A object representing the base style of this paragraph. The base style also affects the character style of any text added to this paragraph. If this is null, the style will be "Normal".

param.name: props
param.para: A that represents formatting properties that should override the paragraph properties found in the style.

returns.para: A Paragraph object that represents a new empty paragraph at the end of this Element. Even though the paragraph is empty there will always be at least a single carriage return.

para.code: Paragraph p = e.InsertParagraphAfter(doc.Styles[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal], pFormatting);
Dim p As Paragraph = e.InsertParagraphAfter(doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal), pFormatting)

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a new section at the beginning of this Element.

returns.para: A Section object that represents a new section at the beginning of this Element.

para.code: Section sect = e.CreateSectionBefore();
Dim sect As Section = e.CreateSectionBefore()

summary.para: Creates and returns a object that represents a new section at the end of this Element.

returns.para: A Section object that represents a new section at the end of this Element.

para.code: Section sect = e.CreateSectionAfter();
Dim sect As Section = e.CreateSectionAfter()

summary.para: Creates and returns a at the beginning of this Element. The text to be inserted is specified as well as whether this should be a new character run or part of the existing one.

param.name: text
param.para: A String representing the text to insert.

param.name: newRun
param.para: A boolean representing if this should have default formatting and become its own character run (true) or if it should assume the formatting of the first character in this Element, becoming a part of that first character run.

returns.para: The CharacterRun containing the inserted text.

para.code: CharacterRun charRun = e.InsertTextBefore("Here is some text.", true);
Dim charRun As CharacterRun = e.InsertTextBefore("Here is some text.", True)

summary.para: Creates and returns a at the end of this Element. The text to be inserted is specified as well as whether this should be a new character run or part of the previous one.

param.name: text
param.para: A String representing the text to insert.

param.name: newRun
param.para: A boolean representing if this should have default formatting and become its own character run (true) or if it should assume the formatting of the first character in this Element, becoming a part of that first character run.

returns.para: The CharacterRun containing the inserted text.

para.code: CharacterRun charRun = e.InsertTextAfter("Here is some text.", true);
Dim charRun As CharacterRun = e.InsertTextAfter("Here is some text.", True)

summary.para: Creates and returns a at the beginning of this Element. The text to be inserted is specified as well as the font that should override the font found in the style of the character run's enclosing paragraph.

param.name: text
param.para: A String representing the text to insert.

param.name: props
param.para: A object representing the font that should override the font found in the style of the character run's enclosing paragraph.

returns.para: The CharacterRun containing the inserted text.

para.code: CharacterRun charRun = e.InsertTextBefore("Here is some text.", fnt);
Dim charRun As CharacterRun = e.InsertTextBefore("Here is some text.", fnt)

summary.para: Creates and returns a at the end of this Element. The text to be inserted is specified as well as the font that should override the font found in the style of the character run's enclosing paragraph.

param.name: text
param.para: A String representing the text to insert.

param.name: props

Doc.summary: Searches for a string specified by the search parameter, and replaces it with the string specified by the replaceWith parameter. The search string can be a literal, a regular expression, or a combination of both. Since the string can contain regular expressions, use a backslash to escape special characters. Special characters are [\^$.|?*+(){\}.
Doc.param: The string to find and replace.
The replacement string.
Doc.returns: The number of occurences that were found and replaced.

para.code:
Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\myDoc.doc")
'--- Update a copyright '--- Search for: (c) or the copyright symbol in ASCII, one ore more whitespace characters, '--- four digits, and then any number of characters followed by 'Inc.' '--- Replace matches with '(c) 2008 SoftArtisans, Inc.' doc.SearchAndReplace("(\(c\)|\xA9)\s+[0-9]{4}\s+SoftArtisans, Inc\.", "(c) 2008 SoftArtisans, Inc.")

summary.para: Searches for a specified string and returns a collection of type .

param.name: toMatch
param.para: The string to find.

returns.para: A collection of objects.

remarks.para: The search string can be a literal, a regular expression, or a combination of both. Since the string can contain regular expressions, use a backslash to escape special characters. Special characters are [\^$.|?*+(){\}. The collection this method returns implements the .NET IEnumerable interface that can be used to iterate over the search results.

para.code:
'--- Required for IEnumerator Imports System.Collections
Dim app As New WordAppliation() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("c:\myDoc.doc")
'--- Search a document for social security numbers, or any series of '--- nine digits, and remove them. The question mark after each dash '--- makes the presence of the dash optional. Dim searcherator As IEnumerator = (doc.Search("\d\d\d-?\d\d-?\d\d\d\d")).GetEnumerator() While searcherator.MoveNext() Dim match As SearchMatch = searcherator.Current match.Element.DeleteElement() End While

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.ElementModel
member.summary:
This class is the central class of the HWPF object model. All properties that apply to a range of characters in a Word document extend this class.
It is possible to insert text and/or properties at the beginning or end of a range.
Ranges are only valid if there hasn't been an insert in a prior Range since the Range's creation. Once an element (text, paragraph, etc.) has been inserted into a Range, subsequent Ranges become unstable.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

summary.para: This class is used to specify border settings for various entities in a Word document.

remarks.para: You cannot create a object using the new keyword. You must reference an existing Border by using either the Border property of the class or the GetBorder(Border.Location) method of one of the following classes: , or .
The following sample gets the Border object for the bottom part of the upper left table cell of the first table in a document.

para.code:
Dim app As WordApplication = New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim brdr As Border = _ doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Table)(0)(0, 0).GetBorder(Border.Location.Bottom)
'--- Set Width to 1 point brdr.LineWidth = 8 brdr.Style = Border.LineStyle.Single

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the color of this border.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab > Color:

para.code:
'--- Get Color Dim borderColor As System.Drawing.Color = brdr.Color
'--- Set Color brdr.Color = System.Drawing.Color.Blue

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the line width of this border in 1/8 points. (The maximum width is 32 points.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab > Width:

para.code:
'--- Get LineWidth Dim lineWidth As Integer = brdr.LineWidth
'--- Set LineWidth to 1 point brdr.LineWidth = 8

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the line style of this border. (Single, thick, double, etc.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab > Style:

para.code:
'--- Get LineStyle Dim lnStyle As Border.LineStyle = brdr.LineStyle
'--- Set LineStyle brdr.LineStyle = Border.LineStyle.Thick

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the space to maintain between the border and the text in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: The minimum width is 0 points and the maximum width is 32 points. Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab > Options button > From text

para.code:
'--- Get Padding Dim padding As Integer = brdr.Padding
'--- Set Padding to 4 points brdr.Padding = 80

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not the border has a shadow effect.

remarks.para: This is set to false by default.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab > Setting: > Shadow

para.code:
'--- Get HasShadow Dim hasShadow As Boolean = brdr.HasShadow
'--- Set HasShadow brdr.HasShadow = True

Doc.summary: Sets or returns a boolean which specifies whether or not the border graphic is reversed.

remarks.para: This only has an effect on certain line styles which are not symmetrical (for example, http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Border.LineStyle#ThinThickSmallGap). Reversing the right and bottom graphics of certain line styles can create a "3D" effect. CharacterRuns have only one border. Paragraphs have different border parts. For borders around characterRuns, tells you whether or not the right and bottom sides of the border have reversed graphics. For borders around paragraphs, it is necessary to explicitly reverse the right and bottom sides.
Reverse defaults to false which means that by default borders will appear "boxed".
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab > Setting: > Box

para.code:
'--- Get Reverse Dim reverse As Boolean = brdr.Reverse
'--- Set a 3D border around a character run Border brdr = charRun.Font.Border brdr.Reverse = True brdr.LineWidth = 12 brdr.Style = Border.LineStyle.ThinThickSmallGap
'--- Set a 3D border around a paragraph para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Top).Style = Border.LineStyle.ThinThickSmallGap para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Top).LineWidth = 12 para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Left).Style = Border.LineStyle.ThinThickSmallGap para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Left).LineWidth = 12 para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Bottom).Style = Border.LineStyle.ThinThickSmallGap para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Bottom).LineWidth = 12 para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Bottom).Reverse = True para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Right).Style = Border.LineStyle.ThinThickSmallGap para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Right).LineWidth = 12 para.Formatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Right).Reverse = True

summary.para: Used to specify a line style for borders.

Doc.summary: Dashed line with small gaps between the dashes
Thick line over thin line with a large gap between the lines
Thick line over thin line with a medium gap between the lines
Thick line over thin line with a small gap between the lines
Thin line over thick line with a large gap between the lines
Thin line over thick line with a medium gap between the lines
Thin line over thick line with a small gap between the lines
Thick line with thin lines above and below, and large gaps between the lines
Thick line with thin lines above and below, and medium gaps between the lines
Thick line with thin lines above and below, and small gaps between the lines

summary.para: Used to specify the border location. Under certain circumstance it is necessary to specify the location of a border. Not all of these will apply for all circumstances.

member.summary: set a bit within the given field descriptor
member.param: the index of the field descriptor to edit

the bit to set (0 is the rightmost bit, 15 is the leftmost bit)
Note: The most significant bit is the leftmost
whether to set the bit to 1 or 0 (true implies 1)
member.exception: if the index is out of range

members.member:
These sequences of bytes are mostly taken from the Font Family Name (FFN) record in a word file.
To add a new font, make a simple word document which uses that font, open a hex editor (or dump a file using the hex option in Worddump) look for the beginning of the record for your font. The name of each font is listed after the font data. It might be easiest (maybe) to look for 0x190 (bytes 0x90 0x01), which corresponds to the (short)400 you see below, then go two bytes backward, and start from there.
The Font Family Name record is listed in the Word 2000 File Format document, and each parameter of Ffn() corresponds with a field from the Font Family Name record. Good luck!

summary.para: The class represents a contiguous run of characters in the document, all of which have the same formatting.

remarks.para: To insert a new character run into a document, use or . To get an existing character run, use or and check which elements are of type http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Element.Type#CharacterRun.
The following sample demonstrates inserting a new character run into a document and retrieving the first character run from an existing document.

para.code:
'--- Insert a character run at the end of the document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim run As CharacterRun = doc.InsertTextAfter("Hello world!", True)
'--- Get the first character run of an existing document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim firstCharRun As CharacterRun = _ doc.GetElements(Elements.Type.CharacterRun)(0)

member.summary: Returns the number of CHP blocks that were written.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.CHPFormattedDiskPage
member.summary:
Represents a CHP fkp. The style properties for paragraph and character runs are stored in fkps. There are PAP fkps for paragraph properties and CHP fkps for character run properties. The first part of the fkp for both CHP and PAP fkps consists of an array of 4 byte int offsets that represent a Paragraph's or Character run's text offset in the main stream. The ending offset is the next value in the array. For example, if an fkp has X number of Paragraph's stored in it then there are (x + 1) 4 byte ints in the beginning array. The number X is determined by the last byte in a 512 byte fkp.
CHP and PAP fkps also store the compressed styles(grpprl) that correspond to the offsets on the front of the fkp. The offset of the grpprls is determined differently for CHP fkps and PAP fkps.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FormattedDiskPage
member.summary:
Represents an FKP data structure. This data structure is used to store the grpprls of the paragraph and character properties of the document. A grpprl is a list of sprms(decompression operations) to perform on a parent style.
The style properties for paragraph and character runs are stored in fkps. There are PAP fkps for paragraph properties and CHP fkps for character run properties. The first part of the fkp for both CHP and PAP fkps consists of an array of 4 byte int offsets in the main stream for that Paragraph's or Character run's text. The ending offset is the next value in the array. For example, if an fkp has X number of Paragraph's stored in it then there are (x + 1) 4 byte ints in the beginning array. The number X is determined by the last byte in a 512 byte fkp.
CHP and PAP fkps also store the compressed styles(grpprl) that correspond to the offsets on the front of the fkp. The offset of the grpprls is determined differently for CHP fkps and PAP fkps.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FormattedDiskPage.#ctor(System.SByte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Uses a 512-byte array to create a FKP

member.summary: Used to get a text offset corresponding to a grpprl in this fkp.

member.summary: Used to get the end of the text corresponding to a grpprl in this fkp.

member.returns: an int representing an offset in the "WordDocument" stream

summary.p: Represents a class ID (16 bytes). Unlike other little-endian type the {@link ClassID} is not just 16 bytes stored in the wrong order. Instead, it is a double word (4 bytes) followed by two words (2 bytes each) followed by 8 bytes.
The number of bytes occupied by this object in the byte stream.
The bytes making out the class ID in correct order, i.e. big-endian.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.CommentReferences
member.summary: A container for all the CommentReference elements, which will be written out when Process is called on the end of the last paragraph of the document part.
member.remarks: Only the comments which have there start and end written will be written. To note that a comment has been written: This is here because if you write out a CommentRangeStart tag, the comment only appears if there is a CommentReference tag somewhere in the document, so if there's any missing when we get to the end of the document we write them out then. If the last paragraph is consumed, then we create a paragraph, because it shouldn't really have any negative consequences

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IComparableText.GetChildren
member.summary: Iterates over all the children of this text, returning only irreducible elements
member.remarks: Any objects created must be maintained until . In other words the results from this method call should have the same instances as those from the reversed, just in reverse order. This is primarily so that if calling , it can use reference equality to determine when it has returned to the element with the asterisk. This only needs to be maintained until the next call to GetChildrenReversed.
member.returns: An enumeration of all the text contained in this text.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IComparableText.GetChildrenReversed
member.summary: Returns the children of this text in reverse order.
member.remarks: Any objects created must have the same reference as those returned using .
member.returns: The children of this text in reverse order.

member.summary: Returns the text of this text

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IIrreducibleComparableText.CompareTo(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IIrreducibleComparableText,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Compares this text with another text
member.remarks:
The following comparisons have been tested for string vs. xml:
a > [Paragraph] > [VerticalTab] > [tab] > [space]
member.param: another piece of text

The first character from this text to compare. If the return value is zero, this will be updated to the index of the first character not compared. If the return value is not zero, the resulting value of this is undefined.

The first character from the other text to compare. If the return value is zero, this will be updated to the index of the first character not compared, or negative one if the contents of this text have been exhausted. If the return value is not zero, the resulting value of this is undefined.
member.returns: A negative number if this is less than other, zero if they are equal, a positive number if it's greater than other

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IIrreducibleComparableText.Equals(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IIrreducibleComparableText,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Checks if this text is equal to another taking into consideration wildcards.
member.remarks:
Wildcards are only allowed in this text and not in the other. So it's Expression2.Equals(Expression1).
According to Word's Help (http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/word/HP100779691033.aspx) Expression2 must be enclosed in quotation marks so that it is compared as a string.
If the operator is = or <>, Expression2 can contain a question mark (?) to represent any single character or an asterisk (*) to represent any string of characters.
If you use an asterisk in Expression2, the portion of Expression1 that corresponds to the asterisk and any remaining characters in Expression2 cannot exceed 128 characters.
Although, undocumented, if two asterisks (*) are included in Expression2, the second and any following are considered literals. Question Marks (?) are allowed to appear more than once.
This comparison works in the following manner: Call on the first two texts with indexes both 0. If an index becomes -1, move that text to the next in the list and set its index to 0. When reverseDirection becomes true, record both indexes and texts. Start calling .
member.param: another piece of text.

The index in this text to start comparing. If the return value is true, this will be set to the index of the first character not compared, or -1 if the contents of this text have been exhausted. If the return value is false, the resulting value of this is undefined.

The index in the other text to start comparing. If the return value is true, this will be set to the index of the first character not compared, or negative one if the contents of this text have been exhausted. If the return value is false, the resulting value of this is undefined.
This will be set to true when an asterisk is found and comparsions need to be done in reverse.
member.returns: true if this text is equivalent to the other

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IIrreducibleComparableText.ReverseEquals(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.IIrreducibleComparableText,System.Int32@,System.Int32@,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if this text is equal to another taking into consideration wildcards.
member.remarks:
Wildcards are only allowed in this text and not in the other. So it's Expression2.Equals(Expression1).
According to Word's Help (http://office.microsoft.com/en-us/word/HP100779691033.aspx) Expression2 must be enclosed in quotation marks so that it is compared as a string.
If the operator is = or <>, Expression2 can contain a question mark (?) to represent any single character or an asterisk (*) to represent any string of characters.
If you use an asterisk in Expression2, the portion of Expression1 that corresponds to the asterisk and any remaining characters in Expression2 cannot exceed 128 characters.
Although, undocumented, if two asterisks (*) are included in Expression2, the second and any following are considered literals. Question Marks (?) are allowed to appear more than once.
This comparison works in the following manner: Call on the last two texts with indexes both -1. If an index becomes -1, move that text to the previous in the list. When one of the texts is the one recorded when the asterisk was found set its associated stop variable to the one recorded.
member.param: another piece of text.

The index in the text to start comparing. A value of -1 is considered the last character in the text. If the return value is true, this will be set to the index of the first character not compared. If the return value is false, the output of this variable is undefined.

The index in the other text to start comparing. A value of -1 is considered the last character in the text. If the return value is true, this will be set to the index of the first character not compared. If the return value is false, the output of this variable is undefined.
The last character to compare. If -1 the entire text will be compared. This should be the index grabbed from comparing with
The last character in the other text to compare. If -1 the entire text will be compared. This should be the index grabbed from comparing with
member.returns: Returns true if this text is equivalent to the other text. If the indices are equal to the stops and the objects are the ones containing the asterisk, then the two texts are equal.

summary.para: This class contains various settings so imported documents from other versions of Word and competing products will look the way they were intended to.

remarks.para: You cannot create a object using the new keyword. You must get an existing CompatibilitySettings object from a .
The following sample gets the CompatibilitySettings of a document so you can start working with these properties.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim cs As CompatibilitySettings = doc.CompatibilitySettings

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that toggles the suppression of line spacing like Word 5 for Mac.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Options... > Compatibility tab > Compatibility options for [filename].doc section > Options > Suppress extra line spacing at top of page like Word 5.x for the Mac

para.code:
'--- Return SuppressSpacingLike5 Dim suppressSpacingLike5 As Boolean = cs.SuppressSpacingLike5
'--- Set SuppressSpacingLike5 cs.SuppressSpacingLike5 = True

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.Processor
member.summary: Base class for different Word document processors Processor is a class that implements 'Process' method functionality, i.e. does all the work of populating fields with data.

members.member:
Sets the processor to update the if fields during process()
@param newValue if true, process() will update the cached text for all the if fields in the file, otherwise they will be ignored.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.CpToFcConverter
member.summary: Class for converting CPs to FCs when writing to the file.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.CpToFcConverter.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TextRange})
member.summary: Creates a new converter for converting CPs to FCs
member.param: a list of all the ctext ranges written to the file. These should be sorted by CP.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.CpToFcConverter.CpToFc(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the file position corresponding to the given character position.
member.remarks: The end of a text piece is exclusive, so this should only be used for inclusive CPs (ie. the end of a format entry should not use this, but everything else should)
member.param: the character position to convert
member.returns: the FC of the given CP or -1 if the CP is invalid

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.CpToFcConverter.CpToFcAtEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the file position corresponding to the given end character position.
member.remarks: The end of a text piece is exclusive, this will return the end of a text piece if the CP matches, and thus should only be used for the end of other exclusive ranges.
member.param: the character position of the end of some range
member.returns: the FC corresponding to the given CP, or -1 if it's not a valid CP

summary.para: This class is used to control settings for importing data into a table or table cell.

remarks.para: To create a object, use .
To actually import data, use and pass in a DataImportProperties object along with the data to import.

para.code:
Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim importProps As DataImportProperties = doc.CreateDataImportProperties()
'--- Set a few properties importProps.UseColumnNames = True importProps.AutoFit = True
'--- Import data into a new table and apply the DataImportProperties Table dataImportTable = oTable.ImportData(oDataTable, importProps)

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether to use the column names from the data source when importing the data. This property is set to true by default.

para.code:
'--- Return UseColumnNames Boolean useColNames = importProps.UseColumnNames
'--- Set UseColumnNames importProps.UseColumnNames = False

summary.para: Returns or set an int that represents the maximum number of rows to be imported. If more rows than this are in the data source, the extra ones will be ignored.

para.code:
'--- Return MaxRows Dim rows As Integer = importProps.MaxRows
'--- Set MaxRows importProps.MaxRows = 50

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the maximum number of columns to be imported. If more columns than this are in the data source, the extra ones will be ignored.

remarks.para: The default value is 0, which represents unlimited columns.

para.code:
'--- Return MaxColumns Dim cols As Integer = importProps.MaxColumns
'--- Set MaxRows importProps.MaxColumns = 10

summary.para: Sets or returns an array of column indexes specifying the columns to import.

remarks.para: If the length of the specified array is greater than MaxColumns, or exceeds the size of the target area, the columns will be added in the order in which they appear in the array.

para.code:
'--- Return ColumnIndexFilter Dim colIndexes() As Integer = importProps.ColumnIndexFilter
'--- Set ColumnIndexFilter importProps.ColumnIndexFilter = New Integer(){0, 2, 3, 6}

summary.para: Sets or returns an array of columns names specifying the columns to import. If the length of the specified array is greater than MaxColumns, or exceeds the size of the target area, the columns will be added in the order in which they appear in the array.

para.code:
'--- Return ColumnNameFilter Dim colNames As String() = importProps.ColumnNameFilter
'--- Set ColumnNameFilter importProps.ColumnNameFilter = New String() {"Name", "Address", "Zip"}

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing whether or not the table that is automatically created for the imported data will automatically be sized to fit the data being imported.

remarks.para: This is set to false by default.

para.code:
'--- Return AutoFit Dim fit As Boolean = importProps.AutoFit
'--- Set AutoFit importProps.AutoFit = True

summary.para: Sets or returns an that specifies how the imported data should be formatted in the table.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.ISimpleBinding.ShouldntAccessAnyMoreData
member.summary:
Returns true if there is both no data left and that this means we should not access any column info. This should be used to avoid getting data from a row when we're past the end and therefore avoiding an exception.
This was added in response to OWD-3041, where empty data sources would cause weird behavior. Getting information from a row after the end of the data stream would throw an exception in OOXML Excel, but not in Binary Excel. Binary Excel did this check already, and we need to add a similar check to OOXML Excel so that empty data sources don't cause an exception.
In WordWriter this always returns false, since we don't want to avoid accessing info from a row. I think WordWriter handles this case already in some different way, but I haven't looked into it so I don't really know.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.Entry
member.summary: This interface provides access to an object managed by a Filesystem instance. Entry objects are further divided into DocumentEntry and DirectoryEntry instances.
member.author: Marc Johnson (mjohnson at apache dot org)

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.Entry.delete
member.summary:
Delete this Entry. This operation should succeed, but there are special circumstances when it will not:
If this Entry is the root of the Entry tree, it cannot be deleted, as there is no way to create another one.
If this Entry is a directory, it cannot be deleted unless it is empty.
member.returns: true if the Entry was successfully deleted, else false

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.Entry.renameTo(System.String)
member.summary:
Rename this Entry. This operation will fail if:
There is a sibling Entry (i.e., an Entry whose parent is the same as this Entry's parent) with the same name.
This Entry is the root of the Entry tree. Its name is dictated by the Filesystem and many not be changed.
member.param: the new name for this Entry
member.returns: true if the operation succeeded, else false

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.POIFSViewable
member.summary:
Interface for a drill-down viewable object. Such an object has content that may or may not be displayed, at the discretion of the viewer. The content is returned to the viewer as an array or as an Iterator, and the object provides a clue as to which technique the viewer should use to get its content.
A POIFSViewable object is also expected to provide a short description of itself, that can be used by a viewer when the viewable object is collapsed.
member.author: Marc Johnson (mjohnson at apache dot org)

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.POIFSViewable.preferArray
member.summary: Give viewers a hint as to whether to call getViewableArray or getViewableIterator

summary.para: Represents a Word document.

remarks.para: To create a new document, use . To open an existing document, use .
Note: inherits from and inherits a lot basic functionality from that class. Be sure to see the Element API docs when looking for specific functionality.

para.code:
'--- Create a new Word document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create()
'--- Open an existing Word document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc")

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the bookmark in this document that has the specified name.

param.name: name
param.para: The name of the bookmark.

returns.para: A Bookmark object representing the bookmark specified.

para.code: Bookmark oBookmark = oDocument.GetBookmark("MyBookmark");
Dim oBookmark As Bookmark = oDocument.GetBookmark("MyBookmark")

summary.para: Returns the document variable specified by name.

param.name: name
param.para: The name of the variable.

returns.para: The document variable specified by name. If the variable does not exist, returns null.

para.code: string docVariable = doc.GetVariable("var");
Dim docVariable As String = doc.GetVariable("var")

Doc.summary: Sets the value of the variable with the specified name. If the variable does not exist, setVariable creates a new variable. If the variable does exist, setVariable overwrites the existing variable.

param.name: name
param.para: The name of the variable.

param.name: val
param.para: The value of the variable.

para.code: doc.SetVariable("platform", "Windows");
doc.SetVariable("platform", "Windows")

summary.para: Returns a object, which you can then use to set options for importing data into a table in a Word document.

returns.para: A DataImportProperties object, which you can then use to set options for importing data into a table in a Word document.

para.code: DataImportProperties oDataImportProperties = oDocument.CreateDataImportProperties();
Dim oDataImportProperties As DataImportProperties = oDocument.CreateDataImportProperties()

summary.para: Returns a object based on the font used by the Normal Style. You can then change the properties of this font and use it elsewhere.

returns.para: A Font object based on the font used by the Normal Style.

para.code: Font oFont = oDocument.CreateFont();
Dim oFont As Font = oDocument.CreateFont()

summary.para: Returns a object based on the paragraph formatting used by the BodyText style. You can then change the properties of this font and use it elsewhere.

returns.para: A ParagraphFormatting object based on the paragraph formatting used by the BodyText style.

para.code: ParagraphFormatting oParagraphFormatting = oDocument.CreateParagraphFormatting();
Dim oParagraphFormatting As ParagraphFormatting = oDocument.CreateParagraphFormatting()

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the table formatting used by the NormalTable style.

returns.para: A TableFormatting object that represents the table formatting used by the NormalTable style.

para.code: TableFormatting oTableFormatting = oDocument.CreateTableFormatting();
Dim oTableFormatting As TableFormatting = oDocument.CreateTableFormatting()

summary.para: Returns an array of objects that represents all the sections in this Document.
Returns a object representing an image or text that appears in the background of a printed document.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark

summary.para: Returns a object that can be used to get and set various settings that pertain to how Word will display this document.

para.code: WordViewSettings oWordViewSettings = oDocument.ViewSettings;
Dim oWordViewSettings As WordViewSettings = oDocument.ViewSettings

summary.para: Returns a object that can be used to get and set various settings that help Word display documents that were imported from earlier versions and competing products.

para.code: CompatibilitySettings oCompatibilitySettings = oDocument.CompatibilitySettings;
Dim oCompatibilitySettings As CompatibilitySettings = oDocument.CompatibilitySettings

summary.para: Returns a object that can be used to get and set the hyphenation settings for this .

para.code: WordHyphenSettings oWordHyphenSettings = oDocument.HyphenSettings;
Dim oWordHyphenSettings As WordHyphenSettings = oDocument.HyphenSettings

summary.para: Returns a object that can be used to get and set the change tracking settings for this .

para.code: WordChangeTracking oWordChangeTracking = oDocument.ChangeTracking;
Dim oWordChangeTracking As WordChangeTracking = oDocument.ChangeTracking

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if the headers and footers should be different for odd and even pages, such as when the pages in this document will be mirrored. When set to true, it creates one header or footer for even-numbered pages and a different header or footer for odd-numbered pages.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Layout tab > Headers and footers section > Different odd and even

para.code:
'--- Return PrintFacingPages Dim printFacingPages As Boolean = oDocument.PrintFacingPages
'--- Set PrintFacingPages oDocument.PrintFacingPages = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if widow control is in effect for this .

remarks.para: The default value for a new Document is false.

para.code:
'--- Return UseWidowControl Dim useWidowControl As Boolean = oDocument.UseWidowControl
'--- Set UseWidowControl oDocument.UseWidowControl = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if Word will update the styles in the current document to match the styles in the attached Word template (i.e. Normal.dot) each time you open the document in Word. This should be set to true when you want to ensure that your document contains up-to-date style formatting.

remarks.para: The default value for a new is false.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Templates and Add-ins... > Document template section > Automatically update document styles

para.code:
'--- Return MergeStylesFromTemplate Dim mergeStyles As Boolean = oDocument.MergeStylesFromTemplate
'--- Set MergeStylesFromTemplate oDocument.MergeStylesFromTemplate = True

summary.para: Sets or returns an int representing the default tab width for this . The value that is returned is in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or ( 1/1440 in).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Tabs... > Default tab stops

para.code:
'--- Return DefaultTabWidth Dim defaultTabWidth As Integer = oDocument.DefaultTabWidth
'--- Set DefaultTabWidth to 1 inch oDocument.DefaultTabWidth = 1440

summary.para: Returns a DateTime object representing the date this document was created.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Created:

para.code: DateTime oDateTime = oDocument.DateCreated;
Dim oDateTime As DateTime = oDocument.DateCreated

summary.para: Returns a DateTime object representing the date this document was last revised.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Modified:

para.code: DateTime oDateTime = oDocument.DateRevised;
Dim oDateTime As DateTime = oDocument.DateRevised

summary.para: Returns a DateTime object representing the date this document was last printed using Word.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Printed:

para.code: DateTime oDateTime = oDocument.DatePrinted;
Dim oDateTime As DateTime = oDocument.DatePrinted

summary.para: Returns an int representing the number of words in this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Statistics listbox > Words:

para.code: int numWords = oDocument.NumWords;
Dim numWords As Integer = oDocument.NumWords

summary.para: Returns an int representing the number of characters in this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Statistics listbox > Characters:

para.code: int numCharacters = oDocument.NumCharacters;
Dim numCharacters As Integer = oDocument.NumCharacters

summary.para: Returns an int representing the number of paragraphs in this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Statistics listbox > Paragraphs:

para.code: int numParagraphs = oDocument.NumParagraphs;
Dim numParagraphs As Integer = oDocument.NumParagraphs

summary.para: Returns an int representing the number of pages this document had when it was last opened in Word.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Statistics tab > Statistics listbox > Pages:

para.code: int numPages = oDocument.NumPagesOnLastOpen;
Dim numPages As Integer = oDocument.NumPagesOnLastOpen

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if Word will only print the data inside a form field in this document. This is typically used to print the data entered into an online form without printing the online form.

remarks.para: The default value for a new is false.

MS Word equivalent: File menu > Print... > Options... button > Options for current document only section > Print data only for forms
Or
File menu > Page Setup > Paper tab > Print options... button > Options for current document only section > Print data only for forms

para.code:
'--- Return PrintDataInFormFields Dim printData As Boolean = oDocument.PrintDataInFormFields
'--- Set PrintDataInFormFields oDocument.PrintDataInFormFields = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if Word will save only the data entered into a form field (instead of the field itself) for this document. When this is set to true, Word saves the data entered into an online form as a single, tab-delimited record so you can use it in a database. Word saves the file in Text Only file format.

remarks.para: The default value for a new is false.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Options... > Save tab > Save options section > Save data only for forms

para.code:
'--- Return SaveDataInFormField Dim vSaveData As Boolean = oDocument.SaveDataInFormField
'--- Set PrintDataInFormFields oDocument.SaveDataInFormField = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a object representing the gutter position in this document when it is opened in Word. If you have set up your document with facing pages or two pages per sheet (by using Mirror margins, Book fold, or 2 pages per sheet), then this option is not available. Possible values: Side, Top.

remarks.para: The default value for a new is http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Document.Gutter#Side.
MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Margins section > Gutter position:

para.code:
'--- Return GutterPosition Dim oGutterPosition As Document.Gutter = oDocument.GutterPosition
'--- Set GutterPosition oDocument.GutterPosition = Gutter.Top

summary.para: Sets or returns a object representing autoformat type for this document. Possible values: Normal, Letter, Email.

remarks.para: The default value for a new is http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Document.Autoformat#Normal.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Autoformat... > Please select a document type to help improve the formatting process

para.code:
'--- Return AutoformatType Dim oAutoformatType As Document.Autoformat = oDocument.AutoformatType
'--- Set AutoformatType oDocument.AutoformatType = Document.Autoformat.Letter

summary.para: Returns a object that can be used to get and set the protection settings that Word will apply to this document. (Only applicable to Word 2000 or above documents.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Protect document... (plus some additional settings)

para.code: DocumentProtection oDocumentProtection = oDocument.DocumentProtection;
Dim oDocumentProtection As DocumentProtection = oDocument.DocumentProtection

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the Styles embedded in this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Styles and Formatting...

para.code: Styles style = oDocument.Styles;
Dim styles As Styles = oDocument.Styles

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the properties of this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties

para.code: DocumentProperties oDocumentProperties = oDocument.DocumentProperties;
Dim oDocumentProperties As DocumentProperties = oDocument.DocumentProperties

summary.para: A value specifies the type of AutoFormat settings to apply to a document. To select an AutoFormat type in Microsoft Word:

Doc.summary: The document is an email message

summary.para: A value specifies the position of a document's gutter margin. Gutter margins are used in documents that will be bound. A gutter margin is an extra margin on the top or side of the page that ensures that the text is not obscured when the document is bound.

Doc.summary: The gutter margin will be on the left side of odd numbered pages and the right side of even numbered pages.
The gutter margin will be at the top of the document.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentInputStream.available
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes that can be read (or skipped over) from this input stream without blocking by the next caller of a method for this input stream. The next caller might be the same thread or or another thread.
member.returns: the number of bytes that can be read from this input stream without blocking.
member.exception: on error (such as the stream has been closed)

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentInputStream.Close
member.summary: Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentInputStream.markSupported
member.summary: Tests if this input stream supports the mark and reset methods.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentInputStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads the next byte of data from the input stream. The value byte is returned as an int in the range 0 to 255. If no byte is available because the end of the stream has been reached, the value -1 is returned. The definition of this method in java.io.InputStream allows this method to block, but it won't.
member.returns: the next byte of data, or -1 if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentInputStream.skip(System.Int64)
member.summary: Skips over and discards n bytes of data from this input stream. The skip method may, for a variety of reasons, end up skipping over some smaller number of bytes, possibly 0. This may result from any of a number of conditions; reaching end of file before n bytes have been skipped is only one possibility. The actual number of bytes skipped is returned. If n is negative, no bytes are skipped.
member.param: the number of bytes to be skipped.
member.returns: the actual number of bytes skipped.

member.summary: This class provides a wrapper over an OutputStream so that Document writers can't accidently go over their size limits
member.author: Marc Johnson (mjohnson at apache dot org)

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentOutputStream.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.Int32)
member.summary: Create a DocumentOutputStream
member.param: the OutputStream to which the data is actually read
the maximum number of bytes that can be written

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentOutputStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes the specified byte to this output stream. The general contract for write is that one byte is written to the output stream. The byte to be written is the eight low-order bits of the argument b. The 24 high-order bits of b are ignored.
member.param: the byte.
member.exception: if an I/O error occurs. In particular, an IOException may be thrown if the output stream has been closed, or if the writer tries to write too much data.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentOutputStream.write(System.SByte[])
member.summary: Writes b.length bytes from the specified byte array to this output stream.
member.param: the data.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentOutputStream.Flush
member.summary: Flushes this output stream and forces any buffered output bytes to be written out.
member.exception: if an I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DocumentOutputStream.Close

summary.para: This class contains all file properties that are used by Word and Windows Explorer to display and store metadata about documents. None of these properties will affect the content of a document.

remarks.para: You cannot create a object using the new keyword. You must get an existing DocumentProperties object from a .
MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties
The following sample gets the DocumentProperties of a document so you can start working with these properties.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim docProps As DocumentProperties = doc.DocumentProperties

summary.para: Returns an Object that represents the value of the property specified.

param.name: property
param.para: A object that represents the built-in property to set.

returns.para: An Object that represents the value of the property specified.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Custom tab > Properties:

para.code: '--- Return "Author" Property Dim priority As String = _ docProps.GetProperty(DocumentProperties.BuiltInProperty.Author)

summary.para: Returns an Object that represents the value of the property specified.

param.name: propertyName
param.para: A String representing the name of the property to retrieve.

returns.para: An Object that represents the value of the property specified.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Custom tab > Properties:

para.code: //--- Return "Priority" Property string priority = docProps.GetProperty("Priority");
'--- Return "Priority" Property Dim priority As String = docProps.GetProperty("Priority")

summary.para: Sets the value of the specified property.

param.name: property
param.para: A object that represents the built-in property to set.

param.name: propertyValue
param.para: An Object that represents the value of the property specified.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Custom tab > Properties:

para.code: //--- Set "Author" Property docProps.SetProperty(DocumentProperties.BuiltInProperty.Author, "Fred Jones");
'--- Set "Priority" Property docProps.SetProperty(DocumentProperties.BuiltInProperty.Author, "Fred Jones")

summary.para: Sets the value of the specified property.

param.name: propertyName
param.para: A String representing the name of the property to set.

param.name: propertyValue
param.para: An Object that represents the value of the property specified.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Custom tab > Properties:

para.code: //--- Set "Priority" Property docProps.SetProperty("Priority", "high");
'--- Set "Priority" Property docProps.SetProperty("Priority", "high")

summary.para: Returns an Object that represents the value of the custom property specified.

param.name: key
param.para: The name of the property to retrieve.

returns.para: An Object that represents the value of the custom property specified.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Custom tab > Properties:

para.code: //--- Return "Priority" Custom Property string priority = docProps.GetCustomProperty("Priority");
'--- Return "Priority" Custom Property Dim priority As String = docProps.GetCustomProperty("Priority")

summary.para: Sets the specified custom property with a certain value.

param.name: key
param.para: A String that represents name of the property to set.

param.name: value
param.para: An Object that represents the value of the custom property specified.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Custom tab

para.code: //--- Set "Priority" Custom Property docProps.SetCustomProperty("Priority", "High");
'--- Set "Priority" Custom Property docProps.SetCustomProperty("Priority", "High")

summary.para: Sets all the Document properties for this document to their default values.

para.code: docProps.RestoreDefaults();
docProps.RestoreDefaults()

summary.para: Clears all the Document properties for this document.

para.code: docProps.Clear();
docProps.Clear()

summary.para: Returns a String that is the name of the application that created this file.

para.code: string application = docProps.Application;
Dim application As String = docProps.Application

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that is the name of the author that created this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Author:

para.code:
'--- Return Author Dim author As String = docProps.Author
'--- Set Author docProps.Author = "John Doe"

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that is the title of this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Title:

para.code:
'--- Return Author Dim title As String = docProps.Title
'--- Set Author docProps.Title = "Sample Word Document"

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that represents the comments attached to this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Comments:

para.code:
'--- Return Comments Dim comments As String = docProps.Comments
'--- Set Comments docProps.Comments = "This is for our next presentation."

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that represents any company info added to this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Company:

para.code:
'--- Return Company Dim company As String = docProps.Company
'--- Set Company docProps.Company = "SoftArtisans, Inc."

summary.para: Sets or returns an object that represents the creation date of this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > General tab > Created:

para.code:
'--- Return CreationDate Dim oDateTime As DateTime = docProps.CreationDate
'--- Set CreationDate docProps.DateTime = DateTime.Now

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that represents any keywords that are added to this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Keywords:

para.code:
'--- Return Keywords Dim keywords As String = docProps.Keywords
'--- Set Keywords docProps.Keywords = "Confidential, Memo"

summary.para: Sets or returns a DateTime that represents the date this file was last saved.

para.code:
'--- Return LastSavedDate Dim oDateTime As DateTime = docProps.LastSavedDate
'--- Set LastSavedDate docProps.LastSavedDate = DateTime.Now

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that represents the name of the manager in charge of this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Manager:

para.code:
'--- Return Manager Dim manager As String = docProps.Manager
'--- Set Manager docProps.Manager = "John Doe"

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that represents the subject of this file.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Properties > Summary tab > Subject:

para.code:
'--- Return Subject Dim subject As String = docProps.Subject
'--- Set Subject docProps.Subject = "Annual Meeting"

summary.para: {}DocumentProperties.BuiltInProperty contains a set of built-in document property fields.

Doc.summary: The application used to create the document
Last date the document was printed
User that saved the document last
Date the document was last saved
Whether or not links in the document are up-to-date

summary.para: This class is used to get and set document protection settings for a document.

remarks.para: You cannot create a object using the new keyword. You must get an existing DocumentProtection object from a .
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Protect Document...
The following sample gets the DocumentProtection object of a document so you can start working with these properties.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim docProtect As DocumentProtection = doc.DocumentProtection

summary.para: Sets or returns a protection level for the document. Possible values are: None, TrackChanges, Comments, Forms, and ReadOnly.

para.code:
'--- Get ProtectionLevel Dim level As DocumentProtection.ProtectionLevel = docProtect.DocumentProtected
'--- Set ProtectionLevel to allow editing of Forms only docProtect.DocumentProtected = DocumentProtection.ProtectionLevel.Comments

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing whether or not annotations are locked in this document.

para.code:
'--- Get AnnotationsLocked Dim annotationsLocked As Boolean = docProtect.AnnotationsLocked
'--- Set AnnotationsLocked docProtect.AnnotationsLocked = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing whether or not Word will only allow selections in form fields for this document.

para.code:
'--- Get SelectOnlyFormFields Dim selectOnlyFormFields As Boolean = docProtect.SelectOnlyFormFields
'--- Set SelectOnlyFormFields docProtect.SelectOnlyFormFields = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing whether or not Word will lock the Styles in this document.

para.code:
'--- Get StylesLocked Dim stylesLocked As Boolean = docProtect.StylesLocked
'--- Set StylesLocked docProtect.StylesLocked = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing whether or not Word will autoformat to override a style lock down in this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Protect Document... > 1. Formatting restrictions section > Settings... link > Formatting section > Allow AutoFormat to override formatting restrictions

para.code:
'--- Get AutoFormatOverride Dim autoFormatOverride As Boolean = docProtect.AutoFormatOverride
'--- Set AutoFormatOverride docProtect.AutoFormatOverride = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing whether or not Word will enforce document protection in this document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Protect = Tools menu > Protect Document... > 3. Start enforcement section > Yes, Start Enforcing Protection button & Unprotect = Tools menu > Unprotect Document

para.code:
'--- Get EnforceDocumentProtection Dim enforceDocumentProtection As Boolean = docProtect.EnforceDocumentProtection
'--- Set EnforceDocumentProtection docProtect.EnforceDocumentProtection = True

summary.para: A value specifies what type of editing is allowed in the document.

Doc.summary: Only form fields may be modified.
All parts of the document may be modified.
Word's change tracking feature will be enabled.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.DocxException
member.summary: This exception is used to represent when there is an error with an Open Office file itself.
member.remarks: This only applies when the file itself is corrupt. Mostly this would be stuff thrown by the reader, or if the file breaks our restrictions, such as a mergefield with no name, or a field with a mergefield that evaluates to it's operator, or something like that.

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.DocxException.prefix
member.summary: The text that is prefixed to the message passed to the constructor.
member.remarks: If you are writing tests, and need to check the message you can do: prefix + "your message here"

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DummyDataSource
member.summary: HACK: An implementation of a DataSource that does not have an end row and returns a blank string for all columns. When a NEXT field is encountered during template processing the original data source is shifted to the next record, if the original data source is exhausted the DummyDataSource s/b used, because otherwise for table cell repetitions the output file is corrupt (probably due to incorrect character run, cell or paragraph style updates at the end of processing.

member.param: case-insensitive name of the column in the DataSource

member.summary: Retrieves data for the specified column
member.param: 0-based column index

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DynamicAccessorBase
member.summary: This is the internal base class for the DynamicAccessor objects. This class lets you return or generate or access objects dynamically at runtime, for the DynamicWrapper class. This base class contains a dummy getObject method that generates strings on the fly: we use it in our test suite.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DynamicAccessorBase.getObject(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Accessor method:
member.param: row of the simulated ResultSet.
col of the simulated ResultSet.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DynamicWrapper
member.summary:
The intention of the DynamicWrapper.* classes was to generate objects as they are requested, rather than creating large structures in memory. Unfortunately, most of the classes DataTable needs to work are sealed/final (ie. they can't be overridden to dynamically generate the data. So the constructor for this class simply generates the appropriate structure in memory and looks like it's doing it as requested.
See NumberDataReader and StringDataReader for dynamically generated data

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: how many columns are in the simulated ResultSet.
how many rows are in the simulated ResultSet.
String array of column names: should generally match numColumns, but excess columns are allows.
accessor to get or create the value at runtime.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.EscherComplexProperty
member.summary: A complex property differs from a simple property in that the data can not fit inside a 32 bit integer. See the specification for more detailed information regarding exactly what is stored here.

member.summary: Constructs a new escher property. The three parameters are combined to form a property id.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.EscherBlipRecord
member.summary: The blip record is used to hold details about large binary objects that occur in escher such as JPEG, GIF, PICT and WMF files. The contents of the stream is usually compressed. Inflate can be used to decompress the data.
member.author: Glen Stampoultzis

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.EscherContainerRecord

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.EscherClientAnchorRecord
member.summary: The escher client anchor specifies which rows and cells the shape is bound to as well as the offsets within those cells. Each cell is 1024 units wide by 256 units long regardless of the actual size of the cell. The EscherClientAnchorRecord only applies to the top-most shapes. Shapes contained in groups are bound using the EscherChildAnchorRecords.
member.author: Glen Stampoultzis

members.member:
This function is older than the above function, getNameFromProperty(). One may contain properties that the other doesn't, so I'm leaving both in the file just in case.
Concurrent users tried to initialize the properties HashMap, which caused the ConcurrentModificationException mentioned in JIRA OWD-3114. This matches the java version fix, since synchronized on a static function is the same as lock(this).

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FakePlexOfCps
member.summary: This class is used to act as a placeholder in the PlexStorage. It is just a static blob. This is necessary because Word expects trailing data for some plexes. So it has to be written out after the corresponding Plex. The most efficient way to do this is to store it in the PlexStorage and let it be written out as a plex.
member.author: Ryan Ackley
