member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter
member.summary: Class for converting FCs to CPs when reading in the file.
member.remarks: The old ComplexOffsetConverter had a complicated method for finding the beginning of a paragraph start that was contingent on where special characters where located. This may be necessary, but I don't think so. If problems arise add a method to TextPieceTable, findParagraphStart, and then use that start cp instead of the one from the PAPX.

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.ranges
member.summary: A list of all the text ranges sorted by FC.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.List{SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TextRange})
member.summary: Creates a new converter for converting FCs to CPs.
member.param: A list of all the text ranges read in from the file sorted by FC

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.FcToCp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character position corresponding to the given file position.
member.remarks: The end of a text piece is exclusive, so this should only be used for inclusive FCs (ie. the end of a format entry should not use this, but everything else should)
member.param: the file position to convert
member.returns: the CP of the given FC or -1 if the Fc does not point to text

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.FcToCpAtEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character position corresponding to the given end file position.
member.remarks: The end of a text piece is exclusive, this will return the end of a text piece if the FC matches, and thus should only be used for the end of other exclusive ranges.
member.param: the file position of the end of some range
member.returns: the CP corresponding to the given FC or -1 if the FC does not point to valid text

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.FcToCpOrNextValidCp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character position corresponding to the next valid file position.
member.remarks:
This is necessary for two situations:
The first entry in the first FKP saved by Word during a full save will have an FC of 0x600 instead of 0x800 where the text starts, thus that would be considered an invalid FC. This will return the start CP of the first text piece (which would be at FC:0x800), 0.
The first entry in the first FKP of a complex save (at least by our template object) points to the endFC of the last save, which would be invalid. This will find the first text piece of that save, and return its start CP
member.param: the position in the file to search for
member.returns: the CP of the start of the next text piece after the given FC or -1 if there are no text pieces after the given FC

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.fcToCpAtEndOrPreviousValidCp(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the character position corresponding to the given file position, or the next valid CP.
member.remarks: This is pertinent to the start of a range where, if the fc points to text that is no longer valid, the cp will be bumped up to the start of the following text piece. This should be used in conjunction with {@link #fcToCpAtEndOrPreviousValidCp(int)} for finding the end of the range, and then you should check that this falls before the respective end character position, because if the entire range points to invalid text, the range is invalid. Note: the end of a text piece is exclusive, so this should only be used for inclusive FCs (ie. the end of a format entry should not use this, but everything else should)
member.param: the file position to convert
member.returns: the CP of the given FC or, if the FC does not point to valid text, the CP of the next FC which does point to valid text, or if there is no valid text after the given FC, -1

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter.toString
member.summary: returns a string useful for debugging purposes.
member.remarks: Should an actual toString() method be needed, it should create the string in the constructor and cache it.

summary.para: This class is a low level representation of a field. This encompasses many objects in Word, such as merge fields, hyperlinks, TOC entries, etc. Fields are the generic form of what are contained in a Element's inline elements.

remarks.para: To create a field, call the corresponding "insert" method for what you want to create (hyperlink, TOC entry, etc) on an or object.
To get an existing field, use the method and pass in the http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Element.Type#Field parameter to retrieve all fields.
The following sample demonstrates creating a field at the end of a new document and retrieving the first field of an existing document.

para.code:
'--- Insert a field at the end of a new document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim fld As Field = _ doc.InsertHyperlinkAfter("http://www.softartisans.com", "SoftArtisans")
'--- Get the first field of an existing document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim firstField As Field = doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Field)(0)

summary.para: Updates the value of the field.

para.code: field.Update();
field.Update()

summary.para: Returns an object that represents the contents of this field.
Returns a String that represents this field's code.

para.code: string fieldCode = fld.Code;
Dim fieldCode As String = fld.Code

summary.para: Returns a object that represents this field's type.

para.code: Field.FieldType fldType = fld.Type;
Dim fldType As Field.FieldType = fld.Type

summary.para: The class is a general representation that encompasses many Word objects, including merge fields, hyperlinks, and table of contents items. A value specifies the type of field a specific object represents.

members.member: The ftxbxUnion is a C-style 8-byte union where if it's reusable, it's iNextReuse and cReusable, and if it's not reusable, it's cTxbx and cTxbxEdit

summary.para: The class is used to specify formatting that should be applied to a character run. It also represents the fonts of named styles in the document.

remarks.para: There are two ways to obtain an instance of this class. The method creates a new Font object based on the Normal style. Alternately, using , you can create a Font object that is a copy of a particular style's font. The Font object that is returned can then be used in conjunction with methods in the class to create character runs, paragraphs, etc, with specific fonts.
The following example demonstrates both ways of getting a font, first by retrieving the Normal style's font from the document, second by retrieving a copy of the Heading1 style's font.

para.code:
'--- Get Normal font from Document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim normalFont As Font = doc.CreateFont()
'--- Get font from Heading1 Style Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim heading1Font As Font = doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Heading1).Font

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run is bolded.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Font section > Font style: > Bold (or Bold Italic if Italic = true)

para.code:
'--- Return Bold Dim bold As Boolean = oFont.Bold
'--- Set Bold oFont.Bold = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run is italicized.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Font section > Font style: > Italic (or Bold Italic if Bold = true)

para.code:
'--- Return Italic Dim italic As Boolean = oFont.Italic
'--- Set Italic oFont.Italic = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the the Outline effect, displaying the inner and outer borders of each character. (This effect is not available for all fonts.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Outline

para.code:
'--- Return Outlined Dim outlined As Boolean = oFont.Outlined
'--- Set Outlined oFont.Outlined = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Small caps effect, formatting lowercase text as capital letters and reducing their size. Small caps formatting does not affect numbers, punctutation, non-alphabetic chacters, or uppercase letters.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Small caps

para.code:
'--- Return SmallCaps Dim smallCaps As Boolean = oFont.SmallCaps
'--- Set SmallCaps oFont.SmallCaps = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the All caps effect, formatting lowercase text as capital letters and reducing their size. All caps formatting does not affect numbers, punctutation, non-alphabetic chacters, or uppercase letters.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > All caps

para.code:
'--- Return Caps Dim caps As Boolean = oFont.Caps
'--- Set Caps oFont.Caps = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Hidden effect set. If set to true, this font will only be displayed when the display hidden flag is turned on for the containing document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Hidden

para.code:
'--- Return Hidden Dim hidden As Boolean = oFont.Hidden
'--- Set Hidden oFont.Hidden = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Shadow effect, displaying a shadow behind, beneath and to the right of each character.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Shadow

para.code:
'--- Return Shadow Dim shadow As Boolean = oFont.Shadow
'--- Set Shadow oFont.Shadow = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Strikethrough effect, displaying a single line through the text.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Strikethrough

para.code:
'--- Return Strike Dim strike As Boolean = oFont.Strike
'--- Set Strike oFont.Strike = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Emboss effect, displaying the text as if it is raised off the page in relief.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Embossed

para.code:
'--- Return Embossed Dim embossed As Boolean = oFont.Embossed
'--- Set Embossed oFont.Embossed = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Engrave effect, making the text to be imprinted or pressed into the page.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Engrave

para.code:
'--- Return Engraved Dim engraved As Boolean = oFont.Engraved
'--- Set Engraved oFont.Engraved = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if a character run has the Double strikethrough effect, displaying a double line through the text.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Double strikethrough

para.code:
'--- Return Engraved Dim doubleStrike As Boolean = oFont.DoubleStrike
'--- Set Engraved oFont.DoubleStrike = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word will not perform grammar and spell checking on a character run when the document is opened.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: None

para.code:
'--- Return NoProofChecking Dim noProofChecking As Boolean = oFont.NoProofChecking
'--- Set NoProofChecking to not perform grammar and spell check oFont.NoProofChecking = True

summary.para: Sets or returns an float that represents the font size for a character run. The font size will always be a multiple of 0.5.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Size:

para.code:
'--- Return FontSize Dim fontSize As Float = oFont.FontSize
'--- Set FontSize to 16 points oFont.FontSize = 16.0

summary.para: Sets or returns a String that represents the name of the font used in this formatting.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Font:

para.code:
'--- Return FontName Dim fontName As String = oFont.FontName
'--- Set FontName oFont.FontName = "Arial"

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the spacing between characters in a character run in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or ( 1/1440 in). This number can be negative (decreased spacing) or positive (increased spacing).

remarks.para: The minimum value is -1584 pts and the maximum value is 1584 pts. Values beyond this will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Character spacing tab > Spacing:

para.code:
'--- Return CharacterSpacing Dim charSpacing As Integer = oFont.CharacterSpacing
'--- Set CharacterSpacing to 2 points oFont.CharacterSpacing = 40

summary.para: Sets or returns the color of the text in a character run as a object.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Font color:

para.code:
'--- Return TextColor Dim oColor As Color = oFont.TextColor
'--- Set TextColor oFont.TextColor = Color.Red

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the character scaling, stretching or compressing text horizontally as a percentage of its current size. CharacterScaling can be set to a value between 1 and 600 percent. Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Character spacing tab > Scale:

para.code:
'--- Return CharacterScaling Dim charScale As Integer = oFont.CharacterScaling
'--- Set CharacterScaling oFont.CharacterScaling = 100

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents whether the text in this formatting is set to superscript, subscript, or none.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Effects section > Superscript and Subscript

para.code:
'--- Return SuperSubScript Dim oSuperSubScript As Font.ScriptType = oFont.SuperSubScript
'--- Set SuperSubScript to superscript oFont.SuperSubScript = Font.ScriptType.Super

summary.para: Sets or returns a double that represents the vertical position for a character run in half points, lowering or raising the text in relation to the baseline. (For example, 2 points would be 4 half points.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Character spacing tab > Position:

para.code:
'--- Return VerticalPosition Dim verticalPosition As Integer = oFont.VerticalPosition
'--- Set VerticalPosition to 2 points oFont.VerticalPosition = 4

summary.para: Sets or returns a http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Font.UnderlineType+(no+attachments) object that represents the underline type for this formatting.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Underline style:

para.code:
'--- Return Underline Dim oUnderline As Font.UnderlineType = oFont.Underline
'--- Set Underline to Double oFont.Underline = Font.UnderlineType.Double

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the hyphenation rule for a character run.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: None

para.code:
'--- Return HyphenationRule Dim oHyphenationRule As Font.Hyphenation = oFont.HyphenationRule
'--- Set HyphenationRule oFont.HyphenationRule = Font.Hyphenation.ChangeAfter

summary.para: Sets or returns a double that represents the kerning threshold for a character run in points.

remarks.para: If this is zero, then kerning is disabled for a character run. The maximum value is 1638 points. Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.

para.code:
'--- Return Kerning Dim kerning As Integer = oFont.Kerning
'--- Set Kerning to 12 pt oFont.Kerning = 24

summary.para: Sets or returns the underline color for a character run as a object.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Font tab > Underline color:

para.code:
'--- Return UnderlineColor Dim oColor As Color = oFont.UnderlineColor
'--- Set UnderlineColor oFont.UnderlineColor = Color.Blue

summary.para: Returns a object which on which you can manipulate the shading (fill color and/or pattern) properties of a character run.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab

summary.para: Returns a object on which you can manipulate the border properties of a character run.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab

para.code: oFont.Border.LineStyle = Border.LineStyle.Double;
oFont.Border.LineStyle = Border.LineStyle.Double

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the text animation for a character run.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Font... > Text Effects tab > Animations:

para.code:
'--- Return TextAnimation Dim oTextAnimation As Font.TextAnimation = oFont.Animation
'--- Set TextAnimation to LasVegasLights oFont.Animation = Font.TextAnimation.LasVegasLights

summary.para: Sets or returns the highlight color for a character run as a object.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Formatting toolbar > Highlight button

para.code:
'--- Return Highlight Dim oColor As Color = oFont.Highlight
'--- Set Highlight oFont.Highlight = Color.Yellow

summary.para: Types of hyphenation rules that can be applied to a character run.

para.para: Some hyphenation rules are deprecated and will have no effect.

Doc.summary: In a character run, a word that contains a hyphen is split at the hyphen and continued on the next line if it does not fit entirely on the current line.

summary.para: Values used to represent whether a character run is formatting as superscript, subscript, or neither.

Doc.summary: Character run is at default line height.

summary.para: Types of text animation that can be set on a character run.

Doc.summary: The Word text animation named Blinking Background. The colors of both the text and background alternate between their originally assigned values and their opposite colors.
The Word text animation named Las Vegas Lights. The text is circumscribed by a rotating series of differently colored and differently shaped dots.
The Word text animation named Marching Black Ants. The text is circumscribed by a series of black dashes that move clockwise around the text.
The Word text animation named Marching Red Ants. The text is circumscribed by a series of red dashes that move clockwise around the text.
The Word text animation named Shimmer. The text alternates between its normal state and a slightly blurred one.
The Word text animation named Sparkle Text. A pattern of small, differently shaped dots of alternating colors appears in front of the text.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FontTable
member.summary: FontTable or in MS terminology sttbfffn is a common data structure written in all Word files. The sttbfffn is an sttbf where each string is an FFN structure instead of pascal-style strings. An sttbf is a string Table stored in file. Thus sttbffn is like an Sttbf with an array of FFN structures that stores the font name strings
member.author: Praveen Mathew

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.Data.BindingAdvancers.RepeatingAdvancer.footerFormulas
member.summary:
footer formulas are set to have an empty set before actually doing anything. Thus their set index will always be one greater than the others. This allows easier handling later on. Basically when a group or repeat block gets to the end of its set, it advances all the formulas to the next set, since the footer has this blank set at the beginning it will then be on the 'first' set. For example, the sets might look like this at the end of preiterating: header inside footer 3 3 0 7 7 3 5 5 7 5
Now during processing you will start out with: Header=3; Inside=3; Footer=0; And header will be written out, then inside n times then next will return false for the advancer and it will advance all 3 resulting in Header=7; Inside=7; Footer=3; Footer will be written out with the correct value of 3 the outer advancer will finish and go back to the start, at which point Header and insides will be written out until next returns false, and then all three are advanced resulting in Header=5; Inside=5; Footer=7; Repeat, then all three are advanced again so you have Header=null; Inside=null; Footer=5; and the correct value is written out again.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.Data.BindingAdvancers.RepeatingAdvancer.UpdateFormulas
member.summary: This should be called every time PreIterateNext is called successfully, to add the new values to the formulas.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.HeaderFooterTable.CopyHeadersAndFooters(System.Int32,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WWDocument,System.Collections.Generic.List{SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.HeaderFooter},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copies the headers and footers in headersAndFooters into this at the specified 'destination index.
member.param: Document must be the WWDocument this table corresponds to (I think)

OWD-3078 If this is true, then the HeaderFooter list from the section we're copying from must contain atleast one header. If the added section doesn't contain a header and this is true, then we add an empty header as we copy the headerFooter list over. The purpose of this is to prevent inheritance of any headers from any section before this added section.
This is the same as cannotInheritHeader but for the footer.

summary.para: This class represents a hyperlink field in a document.

remarks.para: To create a hyperlink, use . To get the hyperlinks in a , use the method with a http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Element.Type#Hyperlink parameter.
The following sample demonstrates creating a hyperlink at the end of a new document and retrieving the first hyperlink of an existing document.

para.code:
'--- Add a hyperlink to a document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim link As Hyperlink = _ doc.InsertHyperlinkAfter("http://www.softartisans.com", "SoftArtisans")
'--- Get the first hyperlink from a document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim link As Hyperlink = _ doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Hyperlink)(0)

summary.para: Returns the URL that the hyperlink points to.

para.code: string url = link.GetUrlString();
Dim url As String = link.GetUrlString()

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.IfFieldMarker.setData(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.DataSource,System.String,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.DataSourceStorage,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordWriterPropertyBag)
member.summary: Sets the cached text in the IF field to be the actual one based one the evaluation of the operator and expressions.

member.summary: Parse the given text into the different parts of the If field.
member.param: the unparsed text of the if field

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.IfFieldMarker.ParagraphFormatEntries
member.summary:
Returns the formatting information for this if field. Right now this just returns an empty list, so any formatting will be lost.
If there is a paragraph start at the start of the original if field, we want to copy the paragraph formatting from the start of the if field, as the start of the entity, otherwise we don't want to copy the paragraph entity.
{if 3 = 4 "true centered" "false" \* MERGEFORMAT }_there
becomes:
false_there
But:
Hello_{if 3 = 4 "true centered" "false" \* MERGEFORMAT }_there
Becomes: Hello_false_there

summary.para: This class is used to represent an inline image in a Word document. The types of images that Word supports are jpg, png, bmp, and gif. Inline images are part of the InlineElement objects of an .

remarks.para: To create a new inline image, use the insert methods for inline images from the Element or class.

summary.para: Returns the image in the given format.

param.name: format
param.para: An of the type you wish to return.

returns.para: A object that represents the image that was inserted.

para.code: System.IO.Stream image = firstImage.GetImage(InlineImage.Bmp);
Dim image As System.IO.Stream = firstImage.GetImage(InlineImage.Bmp)

summary.para: Returns an object that represents the format that the image is stored as in Word. (Jpg, Png, Bmp, Gif)

para.code: InlineImage.Format oImageFormat = oInlineImage.ImageFormat;
Dim oImageFormat As InlineImage.Format = oInlineImage.ImageFormat

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the image's height in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

para.code:
'--- Return Height Dim height As Integer = oInlineImage.Height
'--- Set Height to 2 inches oInlineImage.Height = 2880

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the image's width in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

para.code:
'--- Return Width Dim width As Integer = oInlineImage.Width
'--- Set Width to 3 inches oInlineImage.Width = 4320

summary.para: Sets or returns the image in its default format.

para.code:
'--- Return Image Dim oStream As Stream = oInlineImage.Image
'--- Set Image oInlineImage.Image = oStream

summary.para: Image formats for an inline image.

member.summary: Sets this span, or a subset of this span, to be repeated, based on the given information.

If this span is already set to repeat, this span's info will be updated and a new row span will be created with the other info, and all of this row spans children. The only child of this row span will be the new row span.
This span will get the info with the first startColumn, or if startColumns are equal, the first lastColumn, or if those are equal, it will maintain its original info.
member.param: The index of the first row of the bookmark
The index of the last row of the bookmark
The repeat information

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.TableHandling.IRowSpan.Finalize
member.summary: Returns the actual blocks that are in this span (recursively finalizing child spans).
member.remarks: If this span has info (it is being repeated) then it will be the only one returned.
member.returns: The block structure between the start path and end path of this row span.

member.summary: UNIMPLEMENTED IN V1
UNIMPLEMENTED IN V1

members.member:
This class represents a LicenseKey, version 2.
Changes from Version 1: - Added edition - Added OfficeWriter.NET product key - Removed 4 high bits from Serial Number - Removed 1 high bit from CPU count - Removed 2 high bits from License Authority - Removed 1 high bit from ClientReq - Added edition in high bits from Serial number - added remaining 4 bits to Product (scattered)
geoffk Sep 22, 2003 9:51:46 AM
************************************************************************************************ ************************ DO NOT CHANGE THIS CODE UNLESS ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY ******************* ************************************************************************************************ This code represents our parsing of keys in the wild, and if we change the way that we parse it we may let a wild key validate something it wasn't supposed to e.g. someone's 4x key now supports OW 8 ************************************************************************************************ ************************ DO NOT CHANGE THIS CODE UNLESS ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY ******************* ************************************************************************************************

Validates a single key for a product and version using the ITable interface.
This is designed to be called by a product, checking to make sure that the key it has found will work with the product.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.LicenseKeyValidator.HasExpired(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.LicenseKey)
member.summary:
Checks whether the given key has expired.
UTC time must be used to avoid time zone issues, even though we only compare dates.
member.param: the license key
member.returns: true if the key has expired.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.LicenseKeyValidator.ValidatePackage(System.String,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.LicenseKey.Product,System.Int32,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.ILicenseTable)
member.summary:
Checks to see if the key aKey has a product that is provided by aProduct.aVersion.
This is designed to work with the installer, and checks to see if the key matches any of the products that this installer can provide.
member.param: a key to validate.
The product that should contain the product provided by aKey.
The version of the product that should contain the product provided by aKey.
A table to look up the products in.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.LineSpacingDescriptor
member.summary: This class is used to determine line spacing for a paragraph.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

summary.para: This class is used to represent a list in a Word document. Lists are part of the BlockElement objects of an . Using this class, Lists can be read and written. Lists contain list entries, which are basically paragraphs with additional features.

remarks.para: To create a new list, use or . To get an existing list, use .

summary.para: Returns a object representing the entry at a specified index. The index of list entries starts at 0.

param.name: index
param.para: An int representing the level to get the list entry at.

returns.para: A ListEntry object representing the entry at a specified index.

para.code: ListEntry entry = lst.getEntry(0);
Dim entry As ListEntry = lst.getEntry(0)

summary.para: Returns a object representing a particular level for this lst. The levels start at 0 and end at 8 (9 levels total).

param.name: level
param.para: An int representing the level to get the list level at.

returns.para: A ListLevel object representing a particular level for this lst.

para.code: ListLevel level = lst.GetLevel(0);
Dim level As ListLevel = lst.GetLevel(0)

summary.para: Returns a object representing an empty list entry that is inserted at the given index, which is indented to the level specified. http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/#param-index and http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/#param-level start at 0. The maximum level is 8 (9 levels total).

param.name: index
param.para: An int representing the index at which to insert the new entry.

param.name: level
param.para: An int representing the level to assign to the new entry.

returns.para: A ListEntry object representing the newly inserted entry.

para.code: ListEntry entry = lst.InsertEntry(0, 0);
Dim entry As ListEntry = lst.InsertEntry(0, 0)

summary.para: Returns a object representing an empty list entry added to the end of the list, which is indented to the level specified. http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/#level can be between 0 and 8 (9 levels total).

param.name: level
param.para: An int representing the level to assign to the new entry.

returns.para: A ListEntry object representing the newly added entry.

para.code: ListEntry entry = lst.AddEntry(0);
Dim entry As ListEntry = lst.AddEntry(0)

summary.para: Returns an int representing the number of contiguous entries in this lst.

para.code: int numEntries = lst.NumEntries;
Dim numEntries As Integer = lst.NumEntries

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.ListData.getLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the level associated to a particular List at a particular index.
member.param: 1-based index

summary.para: This class is used to represent an entry in a List inside a Word document. A list entry in Word is basically a numbered paragraph.

remarks.para: The following sample gets the first object of a .
To create a new list entry, use . To get an existing list entry, use to get all elements of type ListEntry.

summary.para: Represents a paragraph in the Word document. Technically, a paragraph is a block of text that ends with a carriage return.

remarks.para: To create a new paragraph, use or . Each of these methods take a single argument of type . This argument can be null. If it is null, the Normal style is used. This method can be called from the object because Document inherits from the class.

para.code:
'--- Insert a paragraph at the end of a new document and add some sample text Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim parargraph As Paragraph = doc.InsertParagraphAfter(Nothing) paragraph.InsertTextAfter("This is a new paragraph.")
'--- Get the first paragraph of an existing document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim blocks() As BlockElements = doc.BlockElements Dim firstParagraph As Paragraph = doc.Elements(Element.Type.Paragraph)(0)

summary.para: Returns or sets an object that represents the Style of this paragraph.

para.code:
'--- Return NamedStyle Dim oNamedStyle As NamedStyle = oParagraph.Style
'--- Set NamedStyle oParagraph.Style = oDocument.Styles(NamedStyle.BuilIn.Heading1)

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the formatting for this paragraph (positioning, line spacing, etc).

para.code:
'--- Return ParagraphFormatting Dim formatting As ParagraphFormatting = oParagraph.ParagraphFormatting
'--- Set ParagraphFormatting oParagraph.ParagraphFormatting = oParagraphFormatting

summary.para: Sets the number of this list entry to "1" and renumbers all subsequent entries in the . This method splits the current ListEntry and all subsequent list entries into a new List.
Sets or returns an int representing the indent level for this list entry.

para.code:
'--- Return LevelNum Dim levelNum As Integer = entry.LevelNum
'--- Set LevelNum to 4th level entry.LevelNum = 3

summary.para: Sets or returns a String representing the bullet text of this entry as it would show up if it was opened in Word.

para.code: string bulletText = entry.BulletText;
Dim bulletText As String = entry.BulletText

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.ParagraphModel.GetVisibleCharacterRuns(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the character runs within this element.
member.remarks: Unlike , this method splits up character runs if they span special characters like end of table cell markers or end of paragraph markers. This method skips the end of paragraph character marker.
member.param: The index in the document of the first character to include
The index in the document of the first character not to include

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.ParagraphModel.addSprmsFromParagraphStyle(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.StyleSheet,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.StyleSheet,System.Int16)
member.summary: This function find the difference between fromStyle and toStyle. Whatever is in fromStyle which isn't in toStyle is applied to _papx as sprms

summary.para: This class is used to manipulate settings for a particular indent level. Things such as number and bullet text and indent change with each indent level in Word.

remarks.para: You cannot create a new object using the new keyword. To get an instance of the ListLevel class, use the method of the class, passing it the index of the level you want to retrieve.
To get an existing list entry, use the getEntry() method of the List class. getEntry accepts a parameter that represents the index of the entry to retrieve.
The following sample demonstrates how to get a ListLevel object for level 2 of a list.

para.code: '--- Get the second level settings of a list Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim lst As List = doc.Lists(0) Dim level As ListLevel = lst.GetLevel(2)

summary.para: Sets the bullet text that will be displayed at the current list level. It uses a pattern. If the text is ASCII codes 0-8, this represents the position of the list entry number for a particular level. A list is at a maximum nine levels deep. For example, in an outline you will have numbering that changes with the level such as 1.1, 1.1.2, and so on.

para.code: //--- Set the 3rd list level to 1.2 level.BulletText = "\u0000.\u0001.\u0002";
'--- Set the 3rd list level to 1.2 level.BulletText = "\u0000.\u0001.\u0002"

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the format for list numbers for this list level.

para.code:
'--- Return NumberFormat Dim numberFormat As WordNumberFormat = level.NumberFormat
'--- Set NumberFormat level.NumberFormat = WordNumberFormat.Ordinal

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the indent for the first line of the entry in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

para.code:
'--- Return NumberIndent Dim numberIndent As Integer = level.NumberIndent
'--- Set NumberIndent to 1/2 inch level.NumberIndent = 720

Doc.summary: Sets or returns an int that represents the indentation for the body of the entry, in twips.

remarks.para: One twip = 1/20 pt = 1/1440 in. is equivalent to Microsoft Word's "Text position" setting. WordWriter's default Indent value for the first list level is 0. By default, WordWriter increments the indentation of lower levels by 0.5''.
To change Word's "Text Position" setting:

item.description: Highlight your list.
Open the Format menu and select Bullets and Numbering.
Select a list style and click Customize.

remarks.para: Indent is a read / write property.

para.code:
'--- Return Indent Dim indent As Integer = level.Indent
'--- Set Indent to 1 inch level.Indent = 1440

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.LittleEndian

summary.para: This class represents a merge field in a document. Merge fields are used in WordWriter templates as data placeholders.

remarks.para: To create a merge field, use or .
The following sample demonstrates creating a merge field at the end of a new document and retrieving the first merge field of an existing document.

para.code:
'--- Insert a merge field at the end of a new document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim mfield As Field = doc.InsertMergeFieldAfter("FieldName", "FieldName")
'--- Get the first merge field of an existing document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim firstMergeField As MergeField = doc.GetElements(Element.Type.MergeField)(0)

summary.para: Returns the merge field's name.

returns.para: The name assigned to the merge field.

the character position of the start of the sub document containing this merge field. Since the character positions for groups are relative to the sub document, this is necessary to give the merge field the correct character positions

summary.para: The class represents a named style, such as "Normal", "Heading 1", etc., that is embedded in a Word document.

remarks.para: You cannot create a new named style programmatically. You can only work with Named Styles that are in an existing document. You can obtain an instance of this class from the collection. You can apply a style to different sections and elements within your document. You cannot, however, modify a named style using WordWriter.
The following sample retrieves a copy of the Heading 1 style and applies it to a new paragraph.

para.code: NamedStyle heading1Style = doc.Styles[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Heading1]; Paragraph p = doc.InsertParagraphAfter(heading1Style);
Dim heading1Style As NamedStyle = doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Heading1) Dim p As Paragraph = doc.InsertParagraphAfter(heading1Style)

summary.para: Returns a String representing the name of this NamedStyle.

para.code: string name = namedStyl.Name;
Dim name As String = namedStyl.Name

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the culture-independent name of this style. This is only useful for built-in styles that come with Word. Any custom styles will return http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/NamedStyle.BuiltIn#UserDefined.

para.code: NamedStyle.BuiltIn builtInStyle = namedStyl.BuiltInStyleName;
Dim builtInStyle As NamedStyle.BuiltIn = namedStyl.BuiltInStyleName

summary.para: Returns a object that is a copy of this style's paragraph formatting. Some style types do not have paragraph formatting. In these cases, this method returns null.

para.code: ParagraphFormatting pFormatting = namedStyl.ParagraphFormatting;
Dim pFormatting As ParagraphFormatting = namedStyl.ParagraphFormatting

summary.para: Returns a object that is a copy of this style's font. Some style types do not have character formatting. In these cases, this method returns null.

para.code: Font fnt = namedStyl.Font;
Dim fnt As Font = namedStyl.Font

summary.para: Returns a object that is a copy of this style's table formatting. Some style types do not have table formatting. In these cases, this method returns null.

para.code: TableFormatting tFormatting = namedStyl.TableFormatting;
Dim tFormatting As TableFormatting = namedStyl.TableFormatting

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the type of this style. Word 2003 supports four style types: Character, Paragraph, Table, and List. Older versions support fewer than this.

para.code: NamedStyle.Type nsType = namedStyl.Type;
Dim nsType As NamedStyle.Type = namedStyl.Type

summary.para: Named styles that are built-in to Word.

Doc.summary: Font: Arial, 16 pt, bold, space before: 12 pt, space after: 3 pt
Font: Arial 14 pt, bold, italic, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Arial 13 pt, bold, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Times New Roman, 14 pt, bold, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Times New Roman, 13 pt, bold, italic, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Times New Roman, 11 pt, bold, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Times New Roman, 12 pt, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Times New Roman, 12 pt, italic, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt
Font: Arial, 11 pt, space before 12 pt, space after 3 pt

summary.para: Types of named styles.

Doc.summary: Character style can contain character formatting only, including font, font size, font style, and font effects (such as small caps or superscript). Character styles can be applied on top of paragraph styles, which means you can use a character style to override the format of a selected portion of a paragraph.
A list style contains paragraph number or bullet formatting for up to nine levels of an outline. All nine levels of formatting are contained in one style.

A paragraph style can contain any kind of paragraph formatting (such as paragraph alignment and indents) and any character formatting that you apply to an entire paragraph (such as font or font size).

Table styles can contain certain elements of table, paragraph, and font formatting. You can apply formatting such as font, borders, shading, and paragraph spacing to the heading row as well as the body rows of a table, and the formatting will automatically adjust to accommodate changes in your table structure.

member.summary: Returns the number of PAP blocks that were written to sys

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.PAPFormattedDiskPage
member.summary:
Represents a PAP FKP. The style properties for paragraph and character runs are stored in fkps. There are PAP fkps for paragraph properties and CHP fkps for character run properties. The first part of the fkp for both CHP and PAP fkps consists of an array of 4 byte int offsets in the main stream for that Paragraph's or Character run's text. The ending offset is the next value in the array. For example, if an fkp has X number of Paragraph's stored in it then there are (x + 1) 4 byte ints in the beginning array. The number X is determined by the last byte in a 512 byte fkp.
CHP and PAP fkps also store the compressed styles(grpprl) that correspond to the offsets on the front of the fkp. The offset of the grpprls is determined differently for CHP fkps and PAP fkps.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.PAPFormattedDiskPage.#ctor(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.FcToCpConverter,System.SByte[],System.SByte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a PAPFormattedDiskPage from a 512 byte array
member.remarks: The start FCs of the created PAPXs might point to text that is no longer there, thus the cp will later have to be set to the end of the previous paragraph when sorted by CP.
member.param: a 512 byte array containing the paragraph formatted disk page

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.XmlProcessingReader.ReadSubtree
member.summary: Returns an instance that can be used to read the current node and all its descendants

remarks.para:
ReadSubtree can be called only on element nodes. When the entire sub-tree has been read, calls to the Read method returns false. When the new XmlReader has been closed, the original XmlReader will be positioned on the EndElement node of the sub-tree. Thus, if you called the ReadSubtree method on the start tag of the book element, after the sub-tree has been read and the new XmlReader has been closed, the original XmlReader is positioned on the end tag of the book element.
You should not perform any operations on the original XmlReader until the new XmlReader has been closed. This action is not supported and can result in unpredictable behavior.
If you want to do path manipulation on the subtree, you should copy the path before calling this method

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.XmlProcessingReader.SkipUntilGoal
member.summary: Skips the reader forward until the already set goal
member.remarks: Goals that point to an EndElement are not supported since the only time this is used in the template will be to skip to an empty element, and that's not completely trivial.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.XmlProcessingReader.ReadUntilGoal(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement)
member.summary: Creates a new reader that will read from this reader until it reaches the specified goal

remarks.para: Once the new reader reaches the specified goal, it will no longer read, and will be true. This reader will then continue reading starting at the goal.

Unlike , Read() does not need to be called, it will be right where you left this one. So if you call this method, the only difference is that the EOF will happen when the goal is reached not the end of the file.
remarks.todo: Many of the methods in XmlProcessingReader have not been implemented, because there is no need; check before using any of the *Path methods.
remarks.para: DO NOT call any methods on this class until has been called. If you do things will get seriously screwed up.

member.param: The first element that will not be read
member.returns: A wrapper reader that will read from this reader until the end is reached.

members.member: (non-Javadoc) @see FCNode#setFC(int)

summary.para: The class is used to specify formatting that should be applied to a paragraph. It also represents the paragraph formatting of named styles in the document.

remarks.para: There are two ways to obtain an instance of this class: Create a new normal paragraph formatting object using the method or access an existing style's paragraph formatting information using the property. The ParagraphFormatting object that is returned can then be used in conjunction with methods in the class to create paragraphs with specific formatting.

The following example demonstrates both ways of getting paragraph formatting, first by retrieving the BodyText style's paragraph formatting from the document, second by retrieving a copy of the BodyText2 style's paragraph formatting. Then, some properties are set and the formatting is applied to a new paragraph.

para.code:
'--- Get BodyText paragraph formatting from Document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim bodyTextFormatting As ParagraphFormatting = _ doc.CreateParagraphFormatting()
'--- Set some properties bodyTextFormatting.PageBreakBefore = True bodyTextFormatting.TextJustification = _ ParagraphFormatting.Justification.Right
'--- Apply it to a new paragraph doc.InsertParagraphAfter(Nothing, bodyTextFormatting)
'--- Get paragraph formatting from BodyText2 Style Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim bodyText2Formatting As ParagraphFormatting = _ doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.BodyText2).ParagraphFormatting
'--- Set some properties bodyText2Formatting.PageBreakBefore = True bodyText2Formatting.TextJustification = _ ParagraphFormatting.Justification.Right
'--- Apply it to a new paragraph doc.InsertParagraphAfter(Nothing, bodyText2Formatting)

summary.para: Sets an int representing the line spacing for a paragraph.

param.name: spacing
param.para: The value for the spacing. The units depend on the type parameter.

param.name: type
param.para: The type of spacing to use. See for a discussion on the different types of spacing.

remarks.para: There are three types of line spacing: AtLeast, Exactly, and Multiple. AtLeast and Exactly are set in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in). Multiple is set in number of lines. AtLeast must be between 0 pt (0 twips) and 1584 pt (31680 twips). Exactly must be between 0.7 pt (14 twips) and 1584 pt (31680 twips). Multiple must be between 1 line and 132 lines. Values beyond these for all 3 types will be adjusted automatically.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing > Spacing section > At:

para.code: '--- Set LineSpacing to 2 lines oParagraphFormatting.SetLineSpacing(2, _ ParagraphFormatting.SpacingRule.Multiple)

summary.para: Returns an int representing the indent of the paragraph in twips.

param.name: indentLocation

summary.para: Returns a object on which you can manipulate the border properties of a paragraph for a specified location. Valid Border locations are: Top, Left, Bottom, Right, Between, and Bar. Bar and Between are less obvious locations and they are explained below.

returns.para: A Border object on which you can manipulate the border properties of a paragraph at the given location.

remarks.para: Between refers to a border to place between conforming paragraphs. Two paragraphs conform when both have borders, their brcLeft and brcRight matches, their widths are the same, they both belong to tables or both do not, and have the same settings.
Bar refers to a border to be displayed on outside of text when facing pages are displayed.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab

para.code: oParagraphFormatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Top).LineStyle = Border.LineStyle.Double;
oParagraphFormatting.GetBorder(Border.Location.Top).LineStyle = _ Border.LineStyle.Double

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word attempts to keep all lines of a paragraph on the same page. (It prevents a page break within a paragraph.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > ParagraphFormatting... > Line and Page Breaks tab > Pagination section > Keep lines together

para.code:
'--- Return KeepLinesTogether Dim keepLinesTogether As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.KeepLinesTogether
'--- Set KeepLinesTogether oParagraphFormatting.KeepLinesTogether = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word attempts to keep a paragraph on the same page as the next paragraph. (It prevents a page break a paragraph and the next paragraph.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Line and Page Breaks tab > Pagination section > Keep with next

para.code:
'--- Return KeepWithNext Dim keepWithNext As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.KeepWithNext
'--- Set KeepWithNext oParagraphFormatting.KeepWithNext = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word will have a paragraph be the start of a new page. (It inserts a manual page break before the paragraph.)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Line and Page Breaks tab > Pagination section > Page break before

para.code:
'--- Return PageBreakBefore Dim pageBreakBefore As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.PageBreakBefore
'--- Set PageBreakBefore oParagraphFormatting.PageBreakBefore = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word will display line numbers next to a paragraph. This property has no effect in documents or sections with no line numbers.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Line and Page Breaks tab > Pagination section > Suppress line numbers

para.code:
'--- Return LineNumberingAllowed Dim lineNumberingAllowed As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.LineNumberingAllowed
'--- Set LineNumberingAllowed oParagraphFormatting.LineNumberingAllowed = True

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the type of line spacing for a paragraph. There are 3 types: AtLeast, Exactly, and Multiple. AtLeast and Exactly use twips to specify a minimum height and exact height respectively. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in). Multiple specifies a spacing as a number of lines. Multiple is the most common type of spacing.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > ParagraphFormatting... > Indents and Spacing > Spacing section > Line spacing:

summary.para: Sets or returns an int representing the amount of whitespace that should be placed above a paragraph in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: This must be between 0 pt (0 twips) and 1584 pt (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing > Spacing section > Before:

para.code:
'--- Return SpaceBefore Dim spaceBefore As Integer = oParagraphFormatting.SpaceBefore
'--- Set SpaceBefore to 12 pt oParagraphFormatting.SpaceBefore = 240

summary.para: Sets or returns an int representing the amount of whitespace that should be placed below a paragraph in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: This must be between 0 pt (0 twips) and 1584 pt (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing tab > Spacing section > After:

summary.para: Returns an object on which you can control the absolute positioning for a paragraph.

para.code: oParagraphFormatting.AbsolutePositioning.X = 100;
oParagraphFormatting.AbsolutePositioning.X = 100

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if auto hyphening is allowed for a paragraph.

remarks.para: The default value for a new paragraph is true.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Line and Page Breaks tab > Don't hyphenate

para.code:
'--- Return AllowAutoHyphenation Dim allowAutoHyphenation As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.AllowAutoHyphenation
'--- Set AllowAutoHyphenation oParagraphFormatting.AllowAutoHyphenation = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean representing if Word will use Widow Control for a paragraph. When set to true, Word will not print the last line of a paragraph by itself at the top of a page (widow) or the first line of a paragraph by itself at the bottom of a page (orphan).

remarks.para: The default value for a new paragraph is true.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Line and Page Breaks tab > Pagination section > Widow/Orphan control

para.code:
'--- Return WidowControl Dim widowControl As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.WidowControl
'--- Set WidowControl oParagraphFormatting.WidowControl = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word will automatically handle spacing above a paragraph.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing tab > Spacing section > Before:

para.code:
'--- Return BeforeAutoSpacing Dim beforeAutoSpacing As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.BeforeAutoSpacing
'--- Set BeforeAutoSpacing oParagraphFormatting.BeforeAutoSpacing = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word will automatically handle spacing below a paragraph.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing tab > Spacing section > After:

para.code:
'--- Return AfterAutoSpacing Dim afterAutoSpacing As Boolean = oParagraphFormatting.AfterAutoSpacing
'--- Set AfterAutoSpacing oParagraphFormatting.AfterAutoSpacing = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the text justification for a paragraph.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing tab > General section > Alignment:

para.code:
'--- Return Justification Dim oJustification As ParagraphFormatting.Justification = _ oParagraphFormatting.TextJustificaiton
'--- Set Justification oParagraphFormatting.TextJustification = _ ParagraphFormatting.Justification.Right

summary.para: Returns a object which on which you can manipulate the shading (fill color and/or pattern) properties of a paragraph.

remarks.para: Note: The shading on a paragraph will be overridden by shading set on a character run.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab

para.code: Shading shading = oParagraphFormatting.Shading;
Dim shading As Shading = oParagraphFormatting.Shading

summary.para: Returns an int representing the line spacing for a paragraph.

remarks.para: There are three types of line spacing: AtLeast, Exactly, and Multiple. AtLeast and Exactly are set in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in). Multiple is set in number of lines. AtLeast must be between 0 pt (0 twips) and 1584 pt (31680 twips). Exactly must be between 0.7 pt (14 twips) and 1584 pt (31680 twips). Multiple must be between 1 line and 132 lines. Values beyond these for all 3 types will be adjusted automatically.
MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Paragraph... > Indents and Spacing > Spacing section > At:
The default value for this property is 2.

para.code: //--- Return LineSpacing int lineSpacing = oParagraphFormatting.LineSpacing;
'--- Return LineSpacing Dim lineSpacing As Integer = oParagraphFormatting.LineSpacing

summary.para: Font alignments for a paragraph.
Indent locations for a paragraph.

Doc.summary: Specifies an indentation between the left margin of a page and the first line of a paragraph.
Specifies an indentation between the left margin of a page and the left edge of a paragraph.
Specifies an indentation between the right margin of a page and the right edge of a paragraph.

summary.para: Justification types for a paragraph.
Line spacing types for a paragraph. If the line spacing is not at least the height of the font used on the line then the top of the character string is truncated.

remarks.para: The default value for the property is Multiple

Doc.summary: Minimum height of the width between lines in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt).
Exact height of the width between lines in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt).
Exact height of the width between lines in number of lines. For example, enter 2 for double spacing.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.ParagraphFormattingModelImpl.TableDataOffset
member.summary: The offset of additional properties for the paragraph
member.remarks:
According to the 2008 documentation:
An unsigned integer that specifies a location in the Data Stream. A PrcData begins at this offset and specifies additional properties for the paragraph. The cbGrpprl member of the referenced PrcData structure MUST NOT be less than 10. If an application processes this PrcData, then it MUST NOT process any more Prls in the array that contained the sprmPTableProps.
SprmPHugePapx and sprmPTableProps can refer to PrcDatas containing each other, but the chain MUST eventually terminate in a PrcData that contains neither sprmPHugePapx nor sprmPTableProps.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement
member.summary: A simple class to keep track of Paths to elements in xml
member.remarks:
For elements that are not empty, the end tag corresponds to if it were empty. This means that calling Enter() and then Exit() will result in the same as calling Pass().
When passing between classes with a reader, this should correspond to the location pointed to by that reader.

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.path
member.summary: Points to the last element entered/exited/passed
member.remarks: If the last element is a 0, then it just entered this node.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor sets the current path to 0

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.Enter
member.summary: Enters the path into a child.
member.remarks: This should be called when a startElement is read (that is not empty)

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.Exit
member.summary: Exits out of a node.
member.remarks: This should be called when an endElement is read (that is not empty)

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.Pass
member.summary: Increments the current path.
member.remarks: This should be called when an Empty element is read in.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.MoveToParent
member.summary: Moves this path back up to it's parent.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.GetReversedPath(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement)
member.summary: Returns the reversed path, so that the first element popped will be the index of the first node.
member.remarks: The reason this is static is so that subclasses can access it for paths that aren't there base
member.example: If the path is 2->3->4, then the first element popped will be 2 and the second 3, and so on
member.param: a path

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.IsShallowerThan(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement)
member.summary: Returns whether the given path is a child (grandchild etc.) of this node or one of its siblings.
member.example: If this path is 1->0, and goal is 4->2->0, then this will return true. If this path is 2->1->0 and goal is 2->1 or 3->1 or 4->2->0 it will return false. The end tag and start tag of the same element have the same depth, and any of that elements children are deeper.
member.param: Another path to be compared with this one
member.returns: true if the other path is deeper in the xml than this one.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.MinusDepth(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement)
member.summary: Returns the difference in between this path's depth and the other's
member.remarks: If the returned value is negative than the given path is deeper than this one, if it's positive than this path is deeper, if zero, than the two paths have the same depth
member.example: If this path is 1->0, and goal is 4->2->0, then this will return 1. If this path is 2->4->0, and goal is 1->0, then this will return -1. If this path is 2->1->0 and goal is 2->1 or 3->1 or 4->2->0 it will return 0. The end tag and start tag of the same element have the same depth, and any of that elements children are deeper.
member.param: Another path to be compared with this one
member.returns: The difference between the depth of this path and that of the given goal.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Compares this path with another
member.param: another path to be compared with this one.
member.returns: true if this is the same path as the other

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.Clone
member.summary: Returns a deep copy of this path

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement.DefaultUpdate(System.Xml.XmlReader,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs the default updating of this path for a node in an element
member.remarks:
You should inline this code if you have to switch over the node type to avoid multiple switches.
Note: this does not update the space context
member.param: An xml reader pointing to some part of xml
Whether whitespace is considered text. If true, whitespace will cause Pass() to be called
member.returns: Whether enter was called or not.

member.summary: A path to an element with the hopes of being the same as another path.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new path, that is already after its goal

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.#ctor(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement)
member.summary: Creates a new path with a given goal
member.param: The goal path that this path is trying to get to

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.SetNewGoal(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElement)
member.summary: Sets a new goal starting from the current path.
member.remarks: After setting the goal, you should confirm that you're not already at/after the goal
member.param: The new path to set as the goal of this path

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.BeforeGoal
member.summary: Whether or not this path is before its goal.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.AfterGoal
member.summary: Whether or not this path is after its goal.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.OnPathToGoal
member.summary: Returns whether or not this path is on a direct path to its goal.
member.remarks: To be on the direct path to its goal it would be at the start element of the node containing the goal something like the following: 2->3>1->0 when the goal is 2->3>1->3->4. Note, however that 2->3>1->2 and 2->3>1->3 would not be on the path to that goal. Also note that this will be false when at the goal.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.CanPass
member.summary: Returns whether calling pass will cause this path to skip over the goal
member.remarks:
If this is false, Enter should be called in order to avoid missing the goal. You can safely pass in one of the scenarios:
The path is already after the goal
The path is in a

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.GoalIsChild
member.summary: After calling Enter, returns whether the goal is a child of the current element.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.PathToElementWithGoal.GoalIsDeeper
member.summary: Whether the goal is deeper in the xml than the current node.
member.remarks: Basically this is whether or not it's some sort of "younger" like a niece or nephew or a child of the current path.

summary.para: This class is used to represent a cursor position in the document. It sits between two characters and its position is represented as the index of the character it sits behind. A object can be obtained from an .

remarks.para: You cannot create a new Position object using the new keyword. You must get a Position object using the method of the Element class (or the class, which inherits from Element ). This method takes a parameter that represents the relative offset from the start of this Element to point at which to get the Position.
The following sample gets a Position object from the start of a Document.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim pos As Position = doc.GetPosition(0)

summary.para: Creates and returns an empty at the point represented by this Position, formatted with the specified style. If this Position is in the middle of a paragraph the containing paragraph will be split.

param.name: style
param.para: The base style of this paragraph. The base style also affects the character style of any text added to this paragraph. If this is null, the style will be "Normal".

returns.para: A newly created Paragraph. Even though the paragraph is empty there will always be at least a single carriage return.

para.code: Paragraph p = pos.InsertParagraph(oDocument.Styles[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal]);
Dim p As Paragraph = pos.InsertParagraph(oDocument.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal))

summary.para: Creates and returns a at this Position. This hyperlink will have the specified url and displayed text.

param.name: url
param.para: A String representing the url to link to.

param.name: display
param.para: A String representing the text that will be displayed in the document for this hyperlink.

returns.para: A Hyperlink object representing the newly created hyperlink.

para.code: Hyperlink link = e.InsertHyperlink("http://www.softartisans.com", "SoftArtisans");
Dim link As Hyperlink = e.InsertHyperlink("http://www.softartisans.com", "SoftArtisans")

summary.para: Creates and returns a at this Position. This merge field will have the specified name and contents.

param.name: fieldName
param.para: A String representing the name of this merge field.

param.name: display
param.para: A String representing the text that will displayed for this merge field in the document.

returns.para: A MergeField object representing the newly created merge field.

para.code: MergeField mfield = e.InsertMergeField("MyField", "ThisNameIsDisplayed");
Dim mfield As MergeField = e.InsertMergeField("MyField", "ThisNameIsDisplayed")

summary.para: Creates and returns an empty at the point represented by this Position. If this Position is in the middle of a section then the containing section will be split.

returns.para: A newly created Section.

para.code: Section sect = pos.InsertSection();
Dim sect As Section = pos.InsertSection()

summary.para: Creates and returns a at the point represented by this Position. The text to be inserted is specified as well as whether this should be a new character run or part of the previous one.

param.name: text
param.para: A String representing the text to insert.

param.name: newRun
param.para: A boolean representing if this should have default formatting and become its own character run (true) or if it should assume the formatting of the first character in this element, becoming a part of that first character run.

returns.para: The CharacterRun containing the inserted text.

para.code: CharacterRun charRun = pos.InsertText("Here is some text.", true);
Dim charRun As CharacterRun = pos.InsertText("Here is some text.", True)

summary.para: Creates and returns an empty at the point represented by this Position. By passing a boolean, it can be a numbered list (true) or a bulleted list (false).

returns.para: A List object representing the newly created empty list.

para.code: List lst = pos.InsertList(true);
Dim lst As List = pos.InsertList(True)

summary.para: Creates and returns a at the point represented by this Position. The table will contain the specified number of rows and columns.

param.name: rows
param.para: An int representing the number of rows the table will have.

param.name: columns
param.para: An int representing the number of columns the table will have.

returns.para: A Table object representing the newly created table.

para.code: Table tbl = pos.InsertTable(2, 3);
Dim tbl As Table = pos.InsertTable(2, 3)

summary.para: Inserts and returns an at the point represented by this Position. The image that is inserted is specified by a fileName string.

param.name: fileName
param.para: A String representing the file anme of the image to insert.

returns.para: An InlineImage object representing the inserted image.

para.code: InlineImage image = pos.InsertImage("C:\\sample.jpg");
Dim image As InlineImage = pos.InsertImage("C:\sample.jpg")

summary.para: Inserts and returns an at the point represented by this Position. The image that is inserted is specified by a object.

param.name: stream
param.para: A Stream object that the image can be read from.

returns.para: An InlineImage object representing the inserted image.

exception.para: If the stream does not contain a supported image format see InlineImage.ImageFormat for a list of supported formats.

summary.para: Returns an int that represents the absolute position in the document.

para.code: int positionValue = pos.PositionValue;
Dim positionValue As Integer = pos.PositionValue

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.ResettableMemoryStream
member.summary: This is a stream which contains a MemoryStream which all method calls are redirected to. The purpose of this function is to allow the user to reset it (through ResetStream()) without deleting this instance of a Stream. For example, an XmlWriter writes everything to a MemoryStream, but every so often you want to get the data from that MemoryStream and empty it to make space for more data. By calling ResetStream(), the XmlWriter doesn't think anything unusual happened to it.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.RewindableOutputRowsHandler`3
member.summary: Handles output rows which are rewindable
member.note: If you have a data source that does not need to be counted you can use this, and so long as you don't call CountRows, it wont matter whether the underlying data source is rewindable or not.

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.RewindableOutputRowsHandler`3.outputRowIterator
member.summary:
We either store everything in memoryStream, or we can use the iterator and generate it on the fly
Since we need the number of rows produced before we produce XML, we sometimes might need to store the stream in memory so we can read through it twice, once to count, and once to process.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.RewindableOutputRowsHandler`3.CountRows
member.summary: Do what CreateOutputRows does, but without creating all those data structures or doing as much processing
