summary.para: A object represents a match in the document found by using the method .

para.code:
'--- Required for IEnumerator Imports System.Collections ... Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("c:\myDoc.doc")
'--- Search a document for social security numbers, or any series of '--- nine digits, and remove them. The question mark after each dash '--- makes the presence of the dash optional. Dim searcherator As IEnumerator = doc.Search(@"\d\d\d-?\d\d-?\d\d\d\d").GetEnumerator() While searcherator.MoveNext() Dim match As SearchMatch = searcherator.Current match.Element.DeleteElement() End While

Doc.summary: Returns the string that matches the specified group. The first group is always the string that matches the entire regular expression. Groups are ordered by the left-to-right order of the left parentheses of the group.

param.name: group
param.para: The 0-based index of the group for which to return a match.

returns.para: The String that matches the specified group.

para.code: string firstGroupMatch = searchMatch.Group(0);
Dim firstGroupMatch As String = searchMatch.Group(0)

summary.para: Replaces this match with the specified string.

param.name: replaceWith
param.para: The replacement string.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\somedoc.doc") Dim searcherator As IEnumerator = doc.Search("crimson") While searcherator.MoveNext() Dim match As SearchMatch = searcherator.Current match.Replace("red") End While

summary.para: Returns an object representing the current text match.

para.code: '--- Search for social security numbers using regular expressions and delete them. Dim app As New WordApplication() Document doc = app.Open("C:\somedoc.doc") Dim matches As SearchMatch() = doc.Search("\s\d\d\d-?\d\d-?\d\d\d\d\s") For Each match As SearchMatch In matches match.Element.Delete() Loop

summary.para: Returns the number of groups found in the current . Regular expression groups are created by adding parentheses to the regular expression. This method should always return at least 1.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\somedoc.doc") Dim searcherator As IEnumerator = doc.Search("\s\d\d\d-?\d\d-?\d\d\d\d\s") While searcherator.MoveNext() Dim match As SearchMatch = searcherator.Current Dim numMatchGroups As Integer = match.GroupCount match.Element.Delete() End While

summary.para: This class is used to represent a section of the document. Many documents will only contain one section. More complex documents will divide the document into multiple sections. A section can be roughly correlated to a chapter in a book. Each section can have different formatting settings, including:

remarks.para: To create a new section, use .
To get an existing section, use .
The following sample shows you how to get the add a new section to a document and how to get the first section of a document.

para.code:
'--- Add a new section to a document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim sect As Section = doc.CreateSectionAfter()
'--- Get the first section of a document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim sect As Section = doc.Sections(0)

summary.para: Returns an object that represents the header of the specified type for this section. The header is returned as a editable element. There are 4 types of headers:

param.name: type
param.para: A object that represents the type of header to return.

returns.para: An Element object that represents the header of the specified type for this section.

para.code: Element oElement = oSection.GetHeader(Section.HeaderFooterType.All);
Dim oElement As Element = oSection.GetHeader(Section.HeaderFooterType.All)

summary.para: Returns an object that represents the footer of the specified type for this section. The footer is returned as a editable element. There are 4 types of footers:

param.name: type
param.para: A object that represents the type of footer to return.

returns.para: An Element object that represents the footer of the specified type for this section.

para.code: Element oElement = oSection.GetFooter(Section.HeaderFooterType.All);
Dim oElement As Element = oSection.GetFooter(Section.HeaderFooterType.All)

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the border of this section at the specified location. You can use the returned object to manipulate the borders for this section. Valid locations: Top, Left, Bottom, Right

returns.para: A Border object that represents the border of this section at the specified location.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and shading... > Borders tab

para.code: Border oBorder = oSection.GetBorder(Border.Location.Top);
Dim oBorder As Border = oSection.GetBorder(Border.Location.Top)

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the type of break (before) this section. There are 5 types of breaks: Continuous, Column, Page, EvenPage, and OddPage.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Layout tab > Section section > Section start:

para.code:
'--- Return Break Dim oBreakType As Section.BreakType = oSection.Break
'--- Set BreakType oSection.Break = Section.BreakType.Column

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not this section has a title page. This can affect page numbering and the appearance of headers and footers.

para.code:
'--- Return HasTitlePage Dim hasTitlePage As Boolean = oSection.HasTitlePage
'--- Set HasTitlePage oSection.HasTitlePage = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the page number format for this section. There are 5 type of page number formats:

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Insert menu > Page Numbers... > Format... button > Number format:

para.code:
'--- Return PageNumberFormat Dim oPageNumberFormat As Section.NumberFormat = oSection.PageNumberFormat
'--- Set PageNumberFormat oSection.PageNumberFormat = Section.NumberFormat.Arabic

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not this section is unlocked.

para.code:
'--- Return Unlocked Dim unlocked As Boolean = oSection.Unlocked
'--- Set Unlocked oSection.Unlocked = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not page numbering will restart at the beginning of this section.

remarks.para: This is set to false by default (it will continue numbering pages from the previous section).
MS Word equivalent: Insert menu > Page Numbers... > Format... button > Page numbering section > Continue from previous section ( false) OR Start at: (true)

para.code:
'--- Return RestartPageNum Dim restartPageNum As Boolean = oSection.RestartPageNum
'--- Set RestartPageNum oSection.RestartPageNum = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the line numbering restart policy for this section. There are 3 options:

remarks.para: This setting defaults to PerPage (line numbering restarts for each page).
MS Word equivalent: File > Page Setup... > Layout tab > Preview section (make sure Apply To: This Section is selected) > Line Numbers... button > Numbering section

para.code:
'--- Return LineNumbering Dim oLineNumbering As Section.LineNumbering = oSection.LineNumberingType
'--- Set LineNumbering oSection.LineNumberingType = Section.LineNumbering.Restart

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the line numbering modulus. This setting is used to set whether line numbers display on every line, every 2nd line, etc. Setting this to 0 (zero) will display no line numbers. Setting this to 1 will display a number by every line. Setting this to 2 will display a number by every 2nd line, etc.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File > Page Setup... > Layout tab > Preview section (make sure Apply To: This Section is selected) > Line Numbers... button > Count by:

para.code:
'--- Return LineNumModulus Dim lineNumModulus As Integer = oSection.LineNumModulus
'--- Set LineNumModulus oSection.LineNumModulus = 2

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the x position of line numbers in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or ( 1/1440 in)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File > Page Setup... > Layout tab > Preview section (make sure Apply To: This Section is selected) > Line Numbers... button > From text:

para.code:
'--- Return LineNumberX Dim lineNumberX As Integer = oSection.LineNumberX
'--- Set LineNumberX to .2 inches oSection.LineNumberX = 288

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will draw vertical lines between columns.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Columns... > Line between

para.code:
'--- Return LinesBetween Dim linesBetween As Boolean = oSection.LinesBetween
'--- Set LinesBetween oSection.LinesBetween = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the page orientation for this section. Possible values: Portrait, Landscape, Mixed

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Orientation section -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return PageOrientation Dim oPageOrientation As Section.Orientation = oSection.PageOrientation
'--- Set PageOrientation oSection.PageOrientation = Section.Orientation.Landscape

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the number that the page numbering starts at for this section.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Insert menu > Page Numbers... > Format... button > Start at:

para.code:
'--- Return FirstPageNum Dim firstPageNum As Integer = oSection.FirstPageNum
'--- Set FirstPageNum oSection.FirstPageNum = 2

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the number that the line numbering starts at for this section.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Layout tab > Line Numbers... button > Start at: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return FirstLineNum Dim firstLineNum As Integer = oSection.FirstLineNum
'--- Set FirstLineNum oSection.FirstLineNum = 2

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the page width for this section in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: Page width may not be smaller than .1" (144 twips) or larger than 22" (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Paper tab > Paper size: section > Width: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return PageWidth Dim pageWidth As Integer = oSection.PageWidth
'--- Set PageWidth to 8.5 inches oSection.PageWidth = 12240

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the page height for this section in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: Page height may not be smaller than .1" (144 twips) or larger than 22" (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Paper tab > Paper size: section > Height: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return PageHeight Dim pageHeight As Integer = oSection.PageHeight
'--- Set PageHeight to 11 inches oSection.PageHeight = 15840

summary.para: Sets or returns the size of printed pages.

para.code: sect1.PageSize = Section.PagePaperSize.A4;
sect1.PageSize = Section.PagePaperSize.A4

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the horizontal distance of the left margin from the left edge of the page for this section. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Left: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return LeftMargin Dim leftMargin As Integer = oSection.LeftMargin
'--- Set LeftMargin to 1 inch oSection.LeftMargin = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the horizontal distance of the right margin from the right edge of the page for this section. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Right: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return RightMargin Dim rightMargin As Integer = oSection.RightMargin
'--- Set RightMargin to 1 inch oSection.RightMargin = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the vertical distance of the top margin from the top edge of the page for this section. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Top: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return TopMargin Dim topMargin As Integer = oSection.TopMargin
'--- Set TopMargin to 1 inch oSection.TopMargin = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the vertical distance of the bottom margin from the bottom edge of the page for this section. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Bottom: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return BottomMargin Dim bottomMargin As Integer = oSection.BottomMargin
'--- Set BottomMargin to 1 inch oSection.BottomMargin = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the gutter width for this section. The gutter adds space to the margin. Gutters are used when a document needs additional space to allow for binding. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: Gutter width may not be smaller than 0" (0 twips) or larger than 22" (31680 twips). Values beyond these will be automatically adjusted.
MS Word equivalent: File menu > Page Setup... > Margins tab > Gutter: -- (Make sure Apply to: This section is selected)

para.code:
'--- Return GutterWidth Dim gutterWidth As Integer = oSection.GutterWidth
'--- Set GutterWidth to 1/2 inch oSection.GutterWidth = 720

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the y coordinate of the header measured from the top edge of the page. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

para.code:
'--- Return HeaderY Dim headerY As Integer = oSection.HeaderY
'--- Set HeaderY to 1 inch oSection.HeaderY = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the y coordinate of the footer measured from the top edge of the page. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

para.code:
'--- Return FooterY Dim footerY As Integer = oSection.FooterY
'--- Set FooterY to 1 inch oSection.FooterY = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the number of columns in this section.

para.code:
'--- Return NumColumns Dim numColumns As Integer = oSection.NumColumns
'--- Set NumColumns oSection.NumColumns = 2

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents where the page border will be applied to.
Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not page borders for this section will always display in front of any objects it may overlap.
Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not the padding for this section's page border will be measured from the edge of the page or from the text it surrounds.
Areas that a border can be applied to for a section.

Doc.summary: Apply border to all but the first page in the section
Apply border to all pages in section
Apply border to all pages in section
Apply border to first page in section

summary.para: Types of breaks that can preceed a section.

Doc.summary: Start this section on the first line after the previous section
Start this section on the first even page after the previous section
Start this section on the first odd page after the previous section
Start this section on the page after the previous section

summary.para: Types of headers and footers.

Doc.summary: Header or footer that is seen over all pages in a section. Has the lowest precedence of any header or footer type.
Header or footer that is seen only on even pages. Takes precedence over "All" headers and footers
Header or footer that is seen on only the first page. Takes precedence over "Odd" headers and footers.
Header or footer that is seen only on odd pages. Takes precedence over "All" headers and footers

summary.para: Line numbering settings for a section.

Doc.summary: Continue from the last line number
Restart the numbers on this section

summary.para: Formats for page numbers in a section.
Page orientations for a section.
Page paper sizes that can be applied to a section. All native sizes are supported, and additional sizes are provided

Doc.summary: There are known issues with this enumeration. Not recommended.
ISO C5 width, ISO C6 height; 4.49" x 9.01"
There are known issues with this enumeration. Not recommended.

summary.para: This class is represents background shading for text, table cells, etc.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab
The following example demonstrates how to get the shading object of a paragraph.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim paragraph As Paragraph = doc.InsertParagraphAfter(Nothing) Dim shad As Shading = paragraph.Formatting.Shading

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the foreground color. This is the alternate color that is used with patterns.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab > Patterns section > Color:

para.code:
'--- Return ForegroundColor Dim clr As Color = shad.ForegroundColor
'--- Set ForegroundColor shad.ForegroundColor = Color.Yellow

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the background (fill) color. This is the main color used for shading.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab > Fill section

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the shading pattern used.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab > Patterns section > Style:

para.code:
'--- Return Pattern Dim shadPattern As Shading.ShadingPattern = shad.Pattern
'--- Set Pattern shad.Pattern = Shading.ShadingPattern.DarkVertical

summary.para: Shading patterns that can be applied to an element.

Doc.summary: Dark crossing vertical and horizontal lines

@return "EOF" state, like java ResultSet.isAfterLast(). @throws provider-specific exception

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.Data.Formulas.StandardDeviationPopulationBinding
member.summary: A Binding to the DataRows for getting the standard deviation of all the numbers in a column, as an entire population.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.Data.Formulas.VarianceBaseBinding
member.summary: The base class for all variance based formulas, such as Standard Deviation, Variance over samples, or over a population.

remarks.para: Implemented using Welford's On-Line algorithm for calculating StandardDeviation. From: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithms_for_calculating_variance#On-line_algorithm Which cites: # ^ Donald E. Knuth (1998). The Art of Computer Programming, volume 2: Seminumerical Algorithms, 3rd edn., p. 232. Boston: Addison-Wesley. Which cites: # ^ B. P. Welford (1962)."Note on a method for calculating corrected sums of squares and products". Technometrics 4(3):419420.
A comparison, and explanation as to why I went with Welford's Algorithm can be found at svn revision: 47084

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.Data.Formulas.StandardDeviationSampleBinding

This stream encapsulates an internal stream from a ZipFile. If you seek to 0, it resets the ZipFile stream to the correct file.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.StyleDescription
member.summary: Comment me
member.author: Ryan Ackley

summary.para: This class is used to store the styles of a document. It is essentially a collection of named styles.

remarks.para: You cannot create styles programmatically. You can only access Named Styles from an existing document. At this time, styles are read-only, but in the future you will be able to modify Named Styles using WordWriter.
The following example demonstrates how to get the styles from a document.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim styls As Styles = doc.Styles

summary.para: Returns an int that represents the number of styles in this collection.

para.code: int length = styls.Length;
Dim length As Integer = styls.Length

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the named style that has the specified string version of its name.

param.name: name
param.para: An String that represents the name of the style's name to retrieve.

returns.para: A NamedStyle object that represents the named style that has the specified string version of its name or the specified index.

para.code:
'--- Get Style by name Dim myStyle As NamedStyle = styls.Item("MyStyle")
'--- Get Style by ID Dim styleZero As NamedStyle = styls.Item(0)

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the named style that has the specified built in name.

param.name: name
param.para: A enumeration that represents the name of the style to retrieve.

returns.para: A NamedStyle object that represents the named style that has the specified built in name.

para.code: //--- Get Style by name NamedStyle myStyle = styls[NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal];
'--- Get Style by name Dim myStyle As NamedStyle = styls.Item(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.Normal)

member.summary: Represents a document's stylesheet. A word documents formatting is stored as compressed styles that are based on styles contained in the stylesheet. This class also contains static utility functions to uncompress different formatting properties.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

summary.para: Represents a table in the Word document.

remarks.para: To create a new table, use or . To get an existing table, use or and check which elements are of type http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/Element.Type#Table.
The following sample demonstrates inserting a new table at the end of a document as well as finding the first table in a document.

para.code:
'--- Insert a table at the end of a new document with 3 rows and 5 columns Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim table As Table = doc.InsertTableAfter(3, 5)
'--- Get the first table of an existing document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim table As Table = doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Table)(0)

summary.para: Returns a double that represents the preferred width of this cell, with the associated units return in http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/#param-units.

param.name: units
param.para:
The for the width.
MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Table tab > Options... > Measure in

returns.para:
The preferred width of the table.
MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Table tab > Options... > dropdown after "Preferred width"

para.code: Units units; double width = table.GetPreferredWidth(out units);
Dim units As Units Dim width As Double = table.GetPreferredWidth(units)

summary.para: Returns an int representing the width of a particular column. The method returns the width of the column in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

param.name: column
param.para: An int representing the column index of the desired column.

returns.para: An int representing the width in twips for the column at the specified column index.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Column tab > Size section > Column #: > Preferred width:

para.code: //--- Get the width of the 3rd column int columnWidth = oTable.GetPreferredColumnWidth(2);
'--- Get the width of the 3rd column Dim columnWidth As Integer = oTable.GetPreferredColumnWidth(2)

summary.para: Sets an int representing the width of a particular column. In order to set the width of a column, you must first set the of that column.

param.name: column
param.para: An int representing the index of the column for which to change the width.

param.name: width
param.para: An int representing the column's new width in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Column tab > Size section > Column #: > Preferred width:

para.code: '--- Set the width of the 3rd column to 1 inch oTable.SetPreferredColumnWidthUnits(2, TableCell.WidthUnits.Twips) oTable.SetPreferredColumnWidth(2, 1440)

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the units used for the width of a particular column.

param.name: column
param.para: An int representing the column index for which to get the width units.

returns.para: A TableCell.WidthUnits object representing the units used at the specified column index.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Column tab > Size section > Column #: > Measure in:

para.code: '--- Get the column width units for the 3rd column Dim oCellWidthUnits As TableCell.WidthUnits = _ oTable.GetPreferredColumnWidthUnits(2)

summary.para: Sets a object that represents the units used for the width of a particular column.

param.name: column
param.para: The column index for which to get the width units.

param.name: units
param.para: The preferred width units.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Column tab > Size section > Column #: > Measure in:

para.code: //--- Set the column width units for the 3rd column to percentage oTable.SetPreferredWidthUnits(2, TableCell.WidthUnits.Percentage);
'--- Set the column width units for the 3rd column to percentage oTable.SetPreferredWidthUnits(2, TableCell.WidthUnits.Percentage)

summary.para: Returns an int representing the height of a particular row in the table. The default row height unit is twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

param.name: row
param.para: An int representing the index of the desired row.

returns.para: An int representing the height in twips of the specified row. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Row tab > Size section > Row #: > Specify height:

para.code: //--- Get the height of the 3rd row int rowHeight = oTable.GetRowHeight(2);
'--- Get the height of the 3rd row Dim rowHeight As Integer = oTable.GetRowHeight(2)

summary.para: Sets an int representing the height of a particular row in the table. A row height is set in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

param.name: row
param.para: An int representing the row index to set the height for.

param.name: height
param.para: An int representing the new height in twips of the specified row. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Row tab > Size section > Row #: > Specify height:

para.code: //--- Set the height of the 3rd row to 1 inch oTable.SetRowHeight(2, 1440);
'--- Set the height of the 3rd row to 1 inch oTable.SetRowHeight(2, 1440)

summary.para: Returns or a boolean that represents if the row height is "exact" (true) or "at least" (false).

param.name: row
param.para: An int representing the row index to get RowHeightExact for.

returns.para: A boolean that represents if the specified row's height is "exact" (true) or "at least" (false).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Row tab > Size section > Row #: > Row height is:
Note: To set this property, you must first set the RowHeight property.

para.code: //--- Get RowHeightExact for the 3rd row bool rowHeightExact = oTable.GetRowHeightExact(2);
'--- Get RowHeightExact for the 3rd row Dim rowHeightExact As Boolean = oTable.GetRowHeightExact(2)

summary.para: Sets a boolean that represents if the row height is "exact" (true) or "at least" (false).

param.name: row
param.para: An int representing the row index to set RowHeightExact for.

param.name: exact
param.para: A boolean that represents if the specified row's height should be "exact" (true) or "at least" (false).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table properties... > Row tab > Size section > Row #: > Row height is:
Note: To set this property, you must first set the RowHeight property.

para.code: //--- Set RowHeightExact for the 3rd row to exact oTable.SetRowHeightExact(2, true);
'--- Set RowHeightExact for the 3rd row to exact oTable.SetRowHeightExact(2, True)

summary.para: Creates a bookmark on the specified row using the specified name.

param.name: row
param.para: An int representing the table cell's row.

param.name: name
param.para: A String representing the bookmark name.

para.code: oTable.CreateBookmarkOnRow(1, "MyBookmark");
oTable.CreateBookmarkOnRow(1, "MyBookmark")

summary.para: Merges the specified set of cells into a single cell.

param.name: firstRow
param.para: The 0-based number of the first row in the set of cells to merge.

param.name: firstCol
param.para: The 0-based number of the first column in the set of cells to merge.

param.name: numRows
param.para: The number of rows to merge.

param.name: numCols
param.para: The number of columns to merge.

para.code: table.MergeCells(3, 2, 4, 1);
table.MergeCells(3, 2, 4, 1)

summary.para: Imports data from an array of objects to the current table.

param.name: row
param.para: An array containing the set of values to import to the table.

para.code: tbl.ImportData(dataArray);
tbl.ImportData(dataArray)

summary.para: Adds a specified number of columns to the horizontal end of the table.

param.name: numColumns
param.para: The number of columns to add to the table.

para.code: tbl.AddColumns(4);
tbl.AddColumns(4)

summary.para: Returns the number of columns in the specified row of the table.

param.name: row
param.para: The row for which to return the nummber of columns.

para.code: tbl.GetNumColumns(4);
tbl.GetNumColumns(4)

summary.para: Inserts one or more columns at the specified position in the table.

param.name: index
param.para: The 0-based index of the first column to insert.

param.name: numColumns
param.para: The number of columns to insert.

para.code: tbl.InsertColumns(2, 5);
tbl.InsertColumns(2, 5)

summary.para: Adds a specified number of rows to the vertical end of the table.

param.name: numRows
param.para: The number of rows to add to the table.

para.code: tbl.AddRows(4);
tbl.AddRows(4)

summary.para: Inserts one or more rows at the specified position in the table.

param.name: index
param.para: The 0-based index of the first row to insert.

param.name: numRows
param.para: The number of rows to insert.

para.code: tbl.InsertRows(2, 5);
tbl.InsertRows(2, 5)

summary.para: Deletes one or more rows from the table.

param.name: startIndex
param.para: The 0-based index of the first row to delete.

param.name: numRows
param.para: The number of rows to delete.

para.code: tbl.DeleteRows(2, 5);
tbl.DeleteRows(2, 5)

summary.para: Deletes one or more columns from the table.

param.name: startIndex
param.para: The 0-based index of the first column to delete.

param.name: numColumns
param.para: The number of columns to delete.

para.code: tbl.DeleteColumns(2, 5);
tbl.DeleteColumns(2, 5)

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the Style of the current table.

para.code:
'--- Return NamedStyle Dim oNamedStyle As NamedStyle = oTable.Style
'--- Set NamedStyle oTable.Style = oDocument.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.NormalTable)

summary.para: Returns an int representing the number of rows in the first row of this table.

para.code: int numRows = oTable.NumRows;
Dim numRows As Integer = oTable.NumRows

summary.para: Returns an object on which you can control the absolute positioning for the table.

para.code: oTable.AbsolutePositioning.X = 100;
oTable.AbsolutePositioning.X = 100

summary.para: Sets or returns a object representing the formatting of this table (borders, padding, shading, etc).

para.code:
'--- Get TableFormatting Dim formatting As TableFormatting = oTable.TableFormatting
'--- Set TableFormatting oTable.TableFormatting = oTableFormatting

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the table cell that exists at the given column and row.

param.name: row
param.para: An int representing the table cell's row.

param.name: column
param.para: An int representing the table cell's column.

returns.para: An TableCell object that represents the table cell that exists at the given column and row.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim tbl As Table = doc.InsertTableAfter(1, 1) Dim tc As TableCell = tbl(0, 0)

summary.para: Represents a table cell in a table in the Word document.

remarks.para: New table cells are created when you create a new . They cannot be created independent of a Table using the new keyword.
To retrieve and manipulate a table cell, use array index notation on a Table object. You can also use to get all elements, of which you can check which ones are of type .
The following sample demonstrates getting a reference to a table cell at column 3 (4th column), row 2 (3rd row).

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim table As Table = doc.GetElements(Element.Type.Table)(0) Dim cell As TableCell = table(3, 2)

summary.para: Returns an int that represents this table cell margin at a particular location in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

param.name: location
param.para: A object that represents ths location of the margin.

returns.para: An int that represents this table cell margin at a particular location in twips.

remarks.para: Allowed locations are Top, Left, Bottom, and Right, which refer to the default margins for those sides of a table cell.
By default, Top and Bottom are set to 0", and Left and Right are set to 0.08".
Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Cell tab > Options... button > Cell margins section

para.code: //--- Return Padding for Left margin int padding = cell.GetPadding(TableCell.Location.Left);
'--- Return Padding for Left margin Dim padding As Integer = cell.GetPadding(TableCell.Location.Left)

summary.para: Sets an int that represents this table cell margin at a particular location in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

param.name: location
param.para: A object that represents ths location of the margin.

param.name: value
param.para: An int representing the value of the margin in twips.

remarks.para: Allowed locations are Top, Left, Bottom, and Right, which refer to the default margins for those sides of a table cell.
By default, Top and Bottom are set to 0", and Left and Right are set to 0.08".
Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Cell tab > Options... button > Cell margins section

para.code: //--- Set Padding for Left margin to 1 inch cell.SetPadding(TableCell.Location.Left, 1440);
'--- Set Padding for Left margin to 1 inch cell.SetPadding(TableCell.Location.Left, 1440)

summary.para: Returns a object that lets you manipulate the border this table cell at a particular location.

param.name: location
param.para: A object that represents the location of the Border to return.

returns.para: A Border object that represents the border for this table cell at a particular location.

remarks.para: Allowed locations are Top, Left, Bottom, and Right. They refer to the border for those sides of the table cell.
Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Borders tab

para.code: //--- Set the Left Border color to blue cell.GetBorder(Border.Location.Left).Color = Color.Blue;
'--- Set the Left Border color to blue cell.GetBorder(Border.Location.Left).Color = Color.Blue

summary.para: Applies properties to all text in this TableCell. The font properties will not be applied to text inside nested tables.

param.name: font
param.para: A Font representing the properties that should be applied to text in this TableCell.

para.code: tblCell.ApplyFont(tblFont);
tblCell.ApplyFont(tblFont)

summary.para: Applies to all paragraphs in this TableCell. The ParagraphFormatting will not be applied to paragraphs inside nested tables.

param.name: formatting
param.para: A ParagraphFormatting object containing formatting properties to apply to the cell.

para.code: tblCell.ApplyParagraphFormatting(paraFormat);
tblCell.ApplyParagraphFormatting(paraFormat)

summary.para: Sets or returns whether this cell has been merged with a preceding horizontal cell.

para.code:
'--- Return Merged Dim merged As Boolean = cell.Merged
'--- Set Merged cell.Merged = True

summary.para: Returns or sets a boolean that represents if this is the first cell in a group of horizontally merged cells. The first cell will contain all the content.

para.code:
'--- Return FirstMerged Dim merged As Boolean = cell.FirstMerged
'--- Set FirstMerged cell.FirstMerged = True

summary.para: Returns or sets a boolean that represents if this cell is merged with one or more cells vertically. The first cell will contain all the content.

para.code:
'--- Return VerticalMerged Dim merged As Boolean = cell.VerticalMerged
'--- Set VerticalMerged cell.VerticalMerged = True

summary.para: Sets or returns whether the current cell is the first cell in a group of vertically merged cells. The first cell will contain all the content.

para.code:
'--- Return FirstVerticalMerged Dim merged As Boolean = cell.FirstVerticalMerged
'--- Set FirstVerticalMerged cell.FirstVerticalMerged = True

summary.para: Returns or sets a object that represents the vertical alignment of the text in this cell.

remarks.para: This is set to http://wiki.softartisans.com/display/WW8/TableCell.VerticalAlignment#Top by default.
MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Cell tab > Vertical alignment

para.code:
'--- Return VertAlignment Dim oVerticalAlignment As TableCell.VerticalAlignment = cell.VertAlignment
'--- Set VertAlignment cell.VertAlignment = TableCell.VerticalAlignment.Center

summary.para: Returns or sets a boolean that represents if Word will prevent text from wrapping in this table cell.

remarks.para: This is set to false by default.
MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Cell tab > Options... button > Options section > Wrap text

para.code:
'--- Return NoWrap Dim noWrap As Boolean = cell.NoWrap
'--- Set NoWrap cell.NoWrap = True

summary.para: Returns or sets an int that represents the preferred width of this cell. In order to set this property, the property must first be set. The width is returned in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Cell tab > Size section > Preferred width:

para.code:
'--- Return PreferredWidth Dim preferredWidth As Integer = cell.PreferredWidth
'--- Set PreferredWidth to 1 inch cell.CellWidthUnits = TableCell.WidthUnits.Twips cell.PreferredWidth = 1440

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the cell width units for this cell.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Cell tab > Size section > Measure in:

para.code:
'--- Return CellWidthUnits Dim widthUnits As TableCell.WidthUnits = cell.CellWidthUnits
'--- Set CellWidthUnits cell.CellWidthUnits = TableCell.WidthUnits.Auto

summary.para: Returns an object which on which you can manipulate the shading (fill color and/or pattern) properties for this cell.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab

para.code: cell.Shading.BackgroundColor = Color.Gray;
cell.Shading.BackgroundColor = Color.Gray

summary.para: Locations within a table cell for which padding values can be set.

Doc.summary: Left side of the table cell
Right side of the table cell

summary.para: Vertical alignments for a table cell.

Doc.summary: Text is aligned from the bottom of the cell
Text is aligned from the center of the cell
Text is aligned from the top of the cell

summary.para: Units used for setting a table cell width.

Doc.summary: Cell width is measured as a percentage of total width
Cell width is measured in twips

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TableCellModel.GetVisibleCharacterRuns(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of all the character runs within this element.
member.remarks: Unlike , this method splits up character runs if they span special characters like end of table cell markers or end of paragraph markers. This method skips the end of cell character marker.

The index in the document of the first character not to include

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TableCharacterTable
member.summary: This class represents a plcf that stores the table state at a certain cp. This isn't documented. I reverse-engineered this structure with a little help from the OOo code base. Tables won't work w/o this.
member.author: Ryan Ackley

summary.para: The class is used to specify formatting that should be applied to a table. It also represents the table formatting of some named styles in the document.

remarks.para: There are two ways to obtain an instance of this class: Create a new normal table formatting object using . This will return a copy of a particular style's table formatting. The TableFormatting object that is returned can then be used in conjunction with methods in the class to create tables with specific formatting.

The following example demonstrates both ways of getting table formatting, first by retrieving the NormalTable style's paragraph formatting from the document, second by retrieving a copy of the TableSimple1 style's paragraph formatting.

para.code:
'--- Get NormalTable formatting from Document Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim normalTableFormatting As TableFormatting = _ doc.CreateTableFormatting()
'--- Get paragraph formatting from SimpleTable1 Style Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim simpleTable1Formatting As TableFormatting = _ doc.Styles(NamedStyle.BuiltIn.SimpleTable1)

summary.para: Returns a object that represents the default border for table cells at a specified location for a table created with this formatting. Individual table cells can override these border settings. Allowed locations are: Top, Left, Bottom, Right, Vertical, and Horizontal. Top, Left, Bottom, and Right refer to the default border for those sides of a table cell. Vertical and Horizontal refer to the border between table cells.

param.name: location
param.para: A object that represents the border location to get the border at.

returns.para: A Border object that represents the default border for table cells at a specified location for a table created with this formatting.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Border and Shading... > Borders tab (With "Apply to: Table" selected)

para.code: //--- Return DefaultBorder Border oBorder = oTableFormatting.GetDefaultBorder(Border.Location.Top);
'--- Return DefaultBorder Dim oBorder As Border = oTableFormatting.GetDefaultBorder(Border.Location.Top)

summary.para: Returns an int that represents the default table cell margin at a particular location. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

param.name: location
param.para: A object that represents ths location of the margin.

returns.para: An int that represents the default table cell margin at a particular location.

remarks.para: Allowed locations are Top, Left, Bottom, and Right, which refer to the default margins for those sides of a table cell.
By default, Top and Bottom are set to 0", and Left and Right are set to 0.08".
Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Table tab > Options... button > Default cell margins section

para.code: '--- Return DefaultPadding for Left margin Dim defaultPadding As Integer = _ oTableFormatting.GetDefaultPadding(TableCell.Location.Left)

summary.para: Sets an int that represents the default table cell margin at a particular location. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

param.name: location
param.para: A object that represents the location at which to set the margin.

param.name: value
param.para: An int that represents the default table cell margin at a particular location in twips.

remarks.para: Allowed locations are Top, Left, Bottom, and Right, which refer to the default margins for those sides of a table cell.
By default, Top and Bottom are set to 0", and Left and Right are set to 0.08".
Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Table tab > Options... button > Default cell margins section

para.code: //--- Set DefaultPadding for Left margin to 1 inch oTableFormatting.SetDefaultPadding(TableCell.Location.Left, 1440);
'--- Set DefaultPadding for Left margin to 1 inch oTableFormatting.SetDefaultPadding(TableCell.Location.Left, 1440)

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents if Word will repeat the first row of a table created with this formatting as a header across multiple pages.

para.code:
'--- Return RepeatAsHeader Dim repeatAsHeader As Boolean = oTableFormatting.RepeatAsHeader
'--- Set RepeatAsHeader oTableFormatting.RepeatAsHeader = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a object that represents the justification for a table created with this formatting. Possible values: Left, Center, Right, LeftRight.

para.code:
'--- Return Justification Dim oJustification As ParagraphFormatting.Justification = _ oTableFormatting.Justification
'--- Set Justification oTableFormatting.Justification = _ ParagraphFormatting.Justification.Center

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will attempt to keep a table created with this formatting on one page.

para.code:
'--- Return CantSplit Dim cantSplit As Boolean = oTableFormatting.CantSplit
'--- Set CantSplit oTableFormatting.CantSplit = True

summary.para: Returns a boolean that represents whether or not this table's width will be set automatically by Word.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Table tab > Options... > Automatically resize to fit contents

para.para: You will have to call [table.SetPreferredColumnWidthUnits(i,TableCell.WidthUnits.Auto)|Table.SetPreferredColumnWidthUnits(Int32, TableCell.WidthUnits)] to have each column adjusted to fit the text

para.code: boolean autoWidth = oTableFormatting.AutoWidth;
Dim autoWidth As Boolean = oTableFormatting.AutoWidth

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the left indent for a table created with this formatting in twips. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

para.code:
'--- Return LeftIndent Dim leftIndent As Integer = oTableFormatting.LeftIndent
'--- Set LeftIndent to 1 inch oTableFormatting.LeftIndent = 1440

summary.para: Returns or sets an int that represents the default spacing between a table's cells that has this formatting. This is the distance in twips between the edge of a cell and the center of its border with an adjacent cell. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in)

remarks.para: By default, this is set to zero (0) for a new table.
Word equivalent: Table menu > Table Properties... > Table tab > Options... button > Default cell spacing section > Allow spacing between cells

para.code:
'--- Return DefaultSpacing Dim defaultSpacing As Integer = oTableFormatting.DefaultSpacing
'--- Set DefaultSpacing to 1/2 inch oTableFormatting.DefaultSpacing = 720

summary.para: Returns an object which on which you can manipulate the default shading (fill color and/or pattern) properties of a table's cells that has this formatting.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: Format menu > Borders and Shading... > Shading tab

para.code: oTableFormatting.Shading.BackgroundColor = Color.Gray;
oTableFormatting.Shading.BackgroundColor = Color.Gray

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.BookmarkTags.TagClump
member.summary: When you have nesting or adjacent bookmarks, Word places multiple bookmarks together, but not always in the correct order; this class handles those bookmark tags.
member.remarks:
Depending on how you insert the bookmarks, nested bookmarks with either no header or footer, could be stored as Gs Bs ... Ge ... Be.
Bookmark tags that are not bound to a repeat block, will be written out once. Those that are tied to a bookmark will not be written out. A tag is considered to be bound to a bookmark if returns that start/end pair.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.BookmarkTags.TagClump.#ctor(SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.XmlPreProcessingReader,SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.DocumentPartProperties)
member.summary: Do not call peek before calling this method.
Do not call peek before calling this method.
member.param: The start tags that should be included in this tag clump, even though they do not appear immediately after the start tag, fore example, in tables, a bookmark that is in a table cell could have its start tag before the cell, but we want the tag clump to be created at the start of the contents of the table cell, so we will pass it the list of all the bookmarks that could end in the cell.

member.summary: Do not call peek before calling this method.
member.param: The start tags that should be included in this tag clump, even though they do not appear immediately after the start tag, fore example, in tables, a bookmark that is in a table cell could have its start tag before the cell, but we want the tag clump to be created at the start of the contents of the table cell, so we will pass it the list of all the bookmarks that could end in the cell.

In some cases you may want to change the path for all the start and end tags (but not this tagClump), to do this you can set this variable to whatever path you want, but be careful managing these children

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.BookmarkTags.TagClump.MoveToParagraphStartTag
member.summary: If one of the start tags needs to be moved to it's parent, all of the remaining ones do also.
member.remarks: If start tags can be moved to the parent, then there is no content in the paragraph before the bookmark tags, implying that the end tags in this clump were also moved to the paragraph tag, thus we do not have to worry about the end tags overlapping with the start tags.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.XmlTemplate.BookmarkTags.TagClump.AlreadyAdded
member.summary: Denotes whether or not this has already been added as the child of a bookmark.
member.remarks:
This is primarily here, because this needs to be inserted in the inner most child with an end tag in this clump. Thus, if a block has a bookmark child, it has no real way of knowing whether that bookmark already added the end tags because of a nested bookmark. So thus it is handled by the tag clump itself.
Once this is set to true, , will also return true.

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.Tbkd
member.summary:
The 2008 Microsoft documentation says: The Tbkd structure is used by PlcftxbxBkd and by PlcfTxbxHdrBkd to associate ranges of text from the Textboxes Document and the Header Textboxes Document with FTXBXS objects from PlcftxbxTxt and PlcfHdrtxbxTxt respectively.
It is contained inside TbkdNode, which is in turn contained in Tbkds

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.Tbkds
member.summary: A PlexOfCps of TbkdNode objects

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.Tbkds.createTerminator
member.summary:
The 2008 documentation says:
"In all but the last Tbkd object, itxbxs MUST be a valid FTXBXS index. The final Tbkd is not associated with any FTXBXS object. The itxbxs value for the final Tbkd MUST be ignored."
This function creates that object at the end.

members.member: This function updates the designated unused final element in the PlexOfCps to still be at the end. See createTerminator() for further explanation.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.Textboxes.createTerminator
member.summary:

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TextPieceTable.minPieceSize
member.summary: For each piece we have to write out a piece descriptor (pcd) and FC which is 12 bytes. OK, I have no idea why this was 8.
member.remarks: Since we have to write 12 bytes out for each piece, it's probably unwise to write out a piece at the end of a span if it's less than this in length. We still need to write out text pieces that are less than this length, thus we still want to write the text piece into a small span, if it fits.

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TextPieceTable.Rangerator.MoveNext(System.Int32)
member.summary: Moves to the next range worth writing to.
member.remarks:
A range is ocnsidered worth writing to if either:
The length of the range is longer than the length of the text when encoded, or
The length of the range is longer than the cost of writing a piece descriptor to the piece table (which is 12 bytes)
member.param: the length of the text piece when encoded.
member.returns: true if a text piece of the given length can be written within the original ranges; false if it could not and the ranges have been exhausted

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.TextRange.ContainsFcAtEnd(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns whether or not the given file position points to a location within this text range with both ends inclusive.
member.remarks: The reason that the start is inclusive is for this situation: The end FC of a character run is set to the start of the next character run, but if the character run ends at the end of a text piece, this means that the end of the character run will point to the start of the next text piece. The same can be applied to paragraph format entries.
member.param: the FC to search for
member.returns: true if the given FC is greater than or equal to the start of this range and less than or equal to the end of this range

member.name: T:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.Shared.TriState

summary.para: Twips are the units of measurement used by the WordWriter API. A single twip represents 1/1440 of an inch. is a utility class that converts between twips and other units of measurement.

para.code: Dim wwApp As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = wwApp.Create() Dim section As Section = doc.CreateSectionAfter() section.PageWidth = TwipsConverter.FromInches(8.5) section.PageHeight = TwipsConverter.FromInches(11)

summary.para: Converts twips to inches. A twip is 1/1440 of an inch.

param.name: twips
param.para: The number of twips to convert to inches.

returns.para: The result of the conversion (inches).

para.code: TwipsConverter.ToInches(12240);
TwipsConverter.ToInches(12240)

summary.para: Converts twips to centimeters. A twip is 1/1440 of an inch and 1/567 of a centimeter.

param.name: twips
param.para: The number of twips to convert to centimeters.

returns.para: The result of the conversion (centimeters).

para.code: TwipsConverter.ToCentimeters(12240);
TwipsConverter.ToCentimeters(12240)

summary.para: Converts twips to points. A twip is 1/1440 of an inch and a point is 1/72 of an inch.

param.name: twips
param.para: The number of twips to convert to centimeters.

returns.para: The result of the conversion (points).

para.code: TwipsConverter.ToPoints(12240);
TwipsConverter.ToPoints(12240)

summary.para: Converts inches to twips. A twip is 1/1440 of an inch.

param.name: inches
param.para: The number of inches to convert.

returns.para: The result of the conversion (twips).

para.code: Dim wwApp As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = wwApp.Create() Dim section As Section = doc.CreateSectionAfter() section.PageWidth = TwipsConverter.FromInches(8.5) section.PageHeight = TwipsConverter.FromInches(11)

summary.para: Converts centimeters to twips. A twip is 1/567 of a centimeter.

param.name: cm
param.para: The number of centimeters to convert.

returns.para: The result of the conversion (twips).

para.code: Dim wwApp As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = wwApp.Create() Dim section As Section= doc.CreateSectionAfter() section.PageWidth = TwipsConverter.FromCentimeters(21.59) section.PageHeight = TwipsConverter.FromCentimeters(27.94)

summary.para:
Converts points to twips. 1 point = 1/72 inch = 20 twips.
1 inch = 72 points = 1440 twips

param.name: pts
param.para: The number of points to convert.

returns.para: The result of the conversion (twips).

para.code: Dim wwApp As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = wwApp.Create() Dim section As Section = doc.CreateSectionAfter() section.PageWidth = TwipsConverter.FromPoints(612) section.PageHeight = TwipsConverter.FromPoints(792)

summary.para: The different types of units used by WordWriter

remarks.para: Not all units are supported by all methods/properties, check the documentation before selecting units.

Doc.summary: Default unit; associated size is ignored
Size is automatically chosen; associated size is ignored
Size is measured as a percent of the total available width

summary.p: [P] FILETIME. The FILETIME structure holds a date and time associated with a file. The structure identifies a 64-bit integer specifying the number of 100-nanosecond intervals which have passed since January 1, 1601. This 64-bit value is split into the two dwords stored in the structure.

summary.para: A object represents a document's watermark, which is an image or text that when printed appears in the background of a document. The property returns a Watermark object.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark

summary.para:
Clears all properties assigned to the watermark.
Call this method to remove a watermark from the document.
Returns the watermark's type, which may be image, text, or none.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark Dim markType As Watermark.Type = wmark.WatermarkType

summary.para: Sets or returns the color of the watermark.

para.code:
Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark
'--- Get Color Dim wmarkColor As System.Drawing.Color = wmark.Color
'--- Set Color wmark.Color = System.Drawing.Color.Blue

summary.para: Sets or returns an image to use as the watermark.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Image = File.Open("somepic.gif")

summary.para: Sets or returns the size of a watermark image as a percentage of its actual size in the source file.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Image = File.Open("somepic.gif") wmark.Scale = 75

summary.para: Sets or returns whether an image watermark will be faded or not.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Image = File.Open("somepic.gif") wmark.Washout = True

summary.para: Sets or returns text to use as the document's watermark.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Text = "CONFIDENTIAL"

summary.para: Sets or returns the font of watermark text.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Text = "CONFIDENTIAL" wmark.FontName = "Arial"

summary.para: Sets or returns the size of watermark text.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Text = "CONFIDENTIAL" wmark.Size = 36

summary.para: Sets or returns the layout of watermark text.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Text = "CONFIDENTIAL" wmark.WatermarkLayout = Watermark.Layout.Diagonal

summary.para: Sets or returns whether a text watermark will be semitransparent or not.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Text = "CONFIDENTIAL" wmark.Semitransparent = True

summary.para: Used to specify the layout for a text watermark.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Dim wmark As Watermark = doc.Watermark wmark.Text = "CONFIDENTIAL" wmark.WatermarkLayout = Watermark.Layout.Diagonal

summary.para: Used to specify a type of watermark.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Create() Watermark wmark = doc.Watermark Watermark.Type markType = wmark.WatermarkType

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WeakReferenceCache.WeakReferenceCacheEnumerator.Reset

member.remarks: Quote from IEnumerator.Reset(). The Reset method is provided for COM interoperability. It does not necessarily need to be implemented; instead, the implementer can simply throw a NotSupportedException.

member.remarks: This should only be called after done iterating through the elements, or the next call to MoveNext() or Current will throw an exception

summary.para: is the main class for pure code-based Word document generation (for information about template-based workbook generation, see ). This class is an engine used to open, create, and write (save to disk or stream to a browser) Word documents. A single instance of WordApplication can generate multiple documents.

remarks.para: A generated document is represented by the class.

The WordApplication class is in the SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter namespace. The class can can be referenced as SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter. To minimize typing and errors, import the namespace to the aspx page, and reference the class as WordApplication, without the namespace prefix. If you are coding directly in the .aspx page, following the Page directive, include:
If you are coding in the code-behind page (.aspx.cs or .aspx.vb), include a using or Imports statement at the top of the code behind page:

para.code: using SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter;
Imports SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter
//--- Create an instance of the WordApplication class WordApplication oWordApplication = new WordApplication();
'--- Create an instance of the WordApplication class Dim oWordApplication As New WordApplication()

member.name: F:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordApplication.mModel
member.summary: TODO: add description

summary.para: Creates a new object

para.code: WordApplication wa = new WordApplication();
Dim wa As New WordApplication()

summary.para: Creates and returns a new based on the Normal style.

returns.para: A new document based on the Normal style.

exception.para: Thrown if an error occurs creating the document.

remarks.para: MS Word equivalent: File > New... > Blank Document

para.code: Document doc = app.Create();
Dim doc As Document = app.Create()

summary.para: Opens and returns an existing from the specified .

param.name: stream
param.para: Stream to read the document from.

returns.para: The document contained in the specified stream.

exception.para: Thrown if there is an error opening the document.

remarks.para: Though the object currently supports Office Open XML (Word 2007) format files, does not yet support them.

para.code: Document doc = app.Open(strm);
Dim doc As Document = app.Open(strm)

summary.para: Opens and returns an existing from disk.

param.name: fileName

returns.para: The document that is opened from disk.

exception.para: Thrown if an error occurs while opening the document.

remarks.para: Though the object currently supports Office Open XML (Word 2007) format files, does not yet support them.

para.code: Document doc = app.Open("@C:\sample.doc");
Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc")

summary.para: Takes a object representing a template Word file, and opens the file as a object.

param.name: wwt
param.para: A WordTemplate object representing a template Word file.

returns.para: The Word file that was passed from WordTemplate to .

exception.para: Thrown if an error occurs while opening the template.

para.code: Dim wTempl As New WordTemplate() ... wTempl.Process() Dim wApp As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = wApp.Open(wTempl)

summary.para: Writes a to a stream in the form of a Microsoft Word document.

param.name: doc
param.para: The Document to save.

param.name: out
param.para: The to write the file to.

exception.para: Thrown if there is a problem saving the file.

remarks.para: The property is used to specify the way WordWriter will save the document. When the preserve property is set to true, WordWriter attempts to preserve all formatting and features that it doesn't directly support. This includes Fields, Footnotes, Hyperlinks, Comments, and Anchored Images. When the preserve property is false, only those features directly supported by WordWriter will be preserved. This includes all Tables, Lists, Headers and Footers.

para.code: app.Save(doc, strm);
app.Save(doc, strm)

summary.para: Writes a to a file.

param.name: doc
param.para: The Document to save.

param.name: fileName
param.para: The full filename to save the Document to.

exception.para: Thrown if there is an error saving the file.

remarks.para: The property is used to specify the way WordWriter will save the document. When the preserve property is set to true, WordWriter attempts to preserve all formatting and features that it doesn't directly support. This includes Fields, Footnotes, Hyperlinks, Comments, and Anchored Images. When the preserve property is false, only those features directly supported by WordWriter will be preserved. This includes all Tables, Lists, Headers and Footers.

para.code: app.Preserve = true; app.Save(doc, "@C:\sample.doc");
app.Preserve = True app.Save(doc, "C:\sample.doc")

summary.para: Streams a to an HttpResponse with the option of having it open in the user's web browser. The fileName specified will appear in the browser window. In addition, the content-type to use when streaming the file is specified.

param.name: doc
param.para: The Document to save.

param.name: response
param.para: The HTTPResponse to write the document to.

param.name: fileName
param.para: The filename to display in the browser window.

param.name: openInBrowser
param.para: Whether to open the document in the browser window (true) or have it open in Word (false).

exception.para: Thrown if there is an error streaming the document.

remarks.para: For the document to open in the browser window, the "Browse in same window" option must be enabled for .doc file types on the client machine.

The property is used to specify the way WordWriter will save the document. When the preserve property is set to true, WordWriter attempts to preserve all formatting and features that it doesn't directly support. This includes Fields, Footnotes, Hyperlinks, Comments, and Anchored Images. When the preserve property is false, only those features directly supported by WordWriter will be preserved. This includes all Tables, Lists, Headers and Footers.

para.code: oWordApplication.Preserve = true; oWordApplication.Save(oDocument, Page.Response, "sample.doc", true);
oWordApplication.Preserve = True oWordApplication.Save(oDocument, Page.Response, "sample.doc", True)

summary.para: Streams a to an HttpResponse with the option of having it open in the user's web browser. The fileName specified will appear in the browser window. In addition, the content-type to use when streaming the file is specified.

param.name: doc
param.para: The Document to save.

param.name: response
param.para: The HTTPResponse to write the document to.

param.name: fileName
param.para: The filename to display in the browser window.

param.name: openInBrowser
param.para: Whether to open the document in the browser window (true) or have it open in Word (false).

param.name: contentType
param.para: The content-type to stream the file as.

exception.para: Thrown if there is an error streaming the document.

remarks.para: For the document to open in the browser window, the "Browse in same window" option must be enabled for .doc file types on the client machine.

The property is used to specify the way WordWriter will save the document. When the preserve property is set to true, WordWriter attempts to preserve all formatting and features that it doesn't directly support. This includes Fields, Footnotes, Hyperlinks, Comments, and Anchored Images. When the preserve property is false, only those features directly supported by WordWriter will be preserved. This includes all Tables, Lists, Headers and Footers.

para.code: app.Preserve = true; app.Save(doc, Page.Response, "sample.doc", false, "application/x-msdownload");
app.Preserve = True app.Save(doc, Page.Response, "sample.doc", False, "application/x-msdownload")

summary.para: Sets or returns the license key used for this instance of . This property is mainly used for debugging purposes. For managing your license keys, please use the License Key Manager that is installed with OfficeWriter.

para.code:
'--- Return license key Dim key As String = oWordApplication.LicenseKey
'--- Set license key oWordApplication.LicenseKey = "XXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXX"

summary.para: Returns the exact version of WordWriter. The format of the version string returned is:

remarks.para: is a Read Only property.

para.code: string ver = oWordApplication.Version;
Dim ver As String = oWordApplication.Version

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not WordWriter will preserve feature of an existing document that it does not natively support. Setting this to false can result in smaller file sizes, but features that are not natively supported by WordWriter will be stripped out. This is set to true by default.

remarks.para: The main advantage to setting the preserve property to false is that it can significantly reduce the file size of the resulting Word document. This is recommended if it is known that only supported features are in the document, especially when creating large documents.

para.code:
'--- Return Preserve Dim preserve As Boolean = oWordApplication.Preserve
'--- Set Preserve oWordApplication.Preserve = False

summary.para: Returns a boolean that represents whether or not WordWriter will write all text using unicode. A value of false can result in smaller file sizes but text that is not part of cp1252 (Windows-1252) will be unreadable. This is set to true by default. It is recommended that you should set this to false if it is known that only characters supported by Windows-1252 are in the document, especially when creating large documents.

para.code:
'--- Return AlwaysUseUnicode Dim alwaysUseUnicode As Boolean = oWordApplication.AlwaysUseUnicode
'--- Set AlwaysUseUnicode oWordApplication.AlwaysUseUnicode = False

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordApplicationModel.open(System.String)
member.summary: An overload of open that takes a filepath instead. This just opens the file and calls open on the resulting stream.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordApplicationModel.LicenseKeyObject
member.summary: This getter performs lazy instantiation. First time this is called. The license key is validated.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordApplicationModel.LicenseKeyAsString
member.summary: This getter performs lazy instantiation.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordApplicationModel.AlwaysUseUnicode
member.summary: A boolean that represents whether or not WordWriter will write all text in unicode.
member.remarks: If this is true WordWriter will write all text in unicode (UTF-16LE); if it's false all text will be written in cp1252 (windows-1252), which results in a smaller file, but removes most international characters. This is set to true by default.

member.name: P:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordApplicationModel.MinimizeFileSize
member.summary: A Boolean that represents whethre or not WordWriter will do its best to minimize the file size.
member.remarks: If this is true WordWriter will result in smaller file sizes, but will run slower and consume more memory. This is set to false by default.

summary.para: This class is used to get and set Word change tracking settings for a document.

remarks.para: You cannot create a new object. You must use to retrieve WordChangeTracking properties for a document.
The following sample gets the WordChangeTracking object of a document so you can start working with its properties.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim changeTracking As WordChangeTracking = doc.ChangeTracking

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not the current revision tracking state is locked.

para.code:
'--- Return LockRevisionMarkingState Dim lockRevisionMarkingState As Boolean = changeTracking.LockRevisionMarkingState
'--- Set LockRevisionMarkingState changeTracking.LockRevisionMarkingState = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will track changes for this document.

remarks.para: This is set to false by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Track Changes

para.code:
'--- Return TrackChanges Dim trackChanges As Boolean = changeTracking.TrackChanges
'--- Set TrackChanges changeTracking.TrackChanges = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will display revisions for this document.

remarks.para: This is set to true by default if TrackChanges is set to true.

para.code:
'--- Return DisplayRevisions Dim displayRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.DisplayRevisions
'--- Set DisplayRevision changeTracking.DisplayRevisions = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will print revision tracking markup when this document is printed.

para.code:
'--- Return PrintRevisions Dim printRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.PrintRevisions
'--- Set PrintRevisions changeTracking.PrintRevisions = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will show revision markup in this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to true by default.

para.code:
'--- Return ShowMarkupRevisions Dim showMarkupRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.ShowMarkupRevisions
'--- Set ShowMarkupRevisions changeTracking.ShowMarkupRevisions = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will show annotations in this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to true by default.

para.code:
'--- Return ShowAnnotationRevisions Dim showAnnotationRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.ShowAnnotationRevisions
'--- Set ShowAnnotationRevisions changeTracking.ShowAnnotationRevisions = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will show insert and delete revisions in this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to true by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Options... > Track changes tab > Markup section > Insertions: and Deletions:

para.code:
'--- Return ShowInsertDeleteRevisions Dim showInsertDeleteRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.ShowInsertDeleteRevisions
'--- Set ShowInsertDeleteRevisions changeTracking.ShowInsertDeleteRevisions = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will show formatting revisions in this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to false by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Options... > Track changes tab > Markup section > Formatting:

para.code:
'--- Return ShowFormattingRevisions Dim showFormattingRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.ShowFormattingRevisions
'--- Set ShowFormattingRevisions changeTracking.ShowFormattingRevisions = True

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will show ink revisions in this document.

para.code:
'--- Return ShowInkRevisions Dim showInkRevisions As Boolean = changeTracking.ShowInkRevisions
'--- Set ShowInkRevisions changeTracking.ShowInkRevisions = True

member.name: M:SoftArtisans.OfficeWriter.WordWriter.WordColor.transposeIco(System.Int32)
member.summary: Switches the first two bytes of the icon integer with the last two bytes of the icon integer. Also negates the alpha component because in .NET 0xff is considered opaque, but in word 00 is.

summary.para: This class is used to get and set Word hyphen settings for a document.

remarks.para: You cannot create a new WordHyphenSettings object. You must use the property to retrieve WordHyphenSettings properties for a document.
The following sample gets the WordHyphenSettings object of a document so you can start working with these properties.

para.code: Dim app As New WordApplication() Dim doc As Document = app.Open("C:\sample.doc") Dim hyphenSettings As WordHyphenSettings = doc.HyphenSettings

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word is allowed to hyphenate words that are capitalized in this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to true by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Language > Hyphenation... > Hyphenate words in CAPS

para.code:
'--- Return CapitalHyphenation Dim capitalHyphenation As Boolean = hyphenSettings.CapitalHyphenation
'--- Set CapitalHyphenation hyphenSettings.CapitalHyphenation = False

summary.para: Sets or returns a boolean that represents whether or not Word will automatically hyphenate this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to false by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Language > Hyphenation... > Automatically hyphenate document

para.code:
'--- Return AutoHyphen Dim autoHyphen As Boolean = hyphenSettings.AutoHyphen
'--- Set AutoHyphen hyphenSettings.AutoHyphen = True

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the hyphenation width in twips for this document. The hyphenation width is the amount of space to leave between the end of the last word in a line and the right margin. To reduce the number of hyphens, make the hyphenation zone wider. To reduce the raggedness of the right margin, make the hyphenation zone narrower. One twip = (1/20 pt) or (1/1440 in).

remarks.para: This option is set to .25 inches (360 twips) by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Language > Hyphenation... > Hyphenation zone:

para.code:
'--- Return HyphenationWidth Dim hypheationWidth As Boolean = hyphenSettings.HyphenationWidth
'--- Set HyphenationWidth to .5 inches (720 twips) hyphenSettings.HyphenationWidth = 720

summary.para: Sets or returns an int that represents the number of consecutive lines that can be auto-hyphenated by Word in this document.

remarks.para: This option is set to No limit by default.
MS Word equivalent: Tools menu > Language > Hyphenation... > Limit consecutive hyphens to:

para.code:
'--- Return AllowedConsecutiveHyphens Dim allowedHyphens As Boolean = hyphenSettings.AllowedConsecutiveHyphens
'--- Set AllowedConsecutiveHyphens hyphenSettings.AllowedConsecutiveHyphens = 1

summary.para: This class is used to enumerate the set of Word's built-in number formats Word. It is used for setting how List elements, footnote numbers, and endnote numbers will appear.

Doc.summary: Arabic Alphabet, Alif Ba Ta sequence
Standard Arabic Numbers with Leading Zeros for Single Digit Values
Chinese Numerals with Parentheses; reverts to Arabic after 10
Chinese Zodiac Elements; reverts to Arabic after 10
Chinese Zodiac Animals; reverts to Arabic after 12
Chinese Zodiac Pairs (Element, Animal); repeats after 60
Double Byte Katakana, a i u e o sequence
Double Byte Katakana, i ro ha sequence
Japanese Katakana Alphabet, a i u e o sequence
Japanese Katakana Alphabet, traditional i ro ha sequence
Korean Consonants with first Vowel; repeats after 14
